module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure

-- | The action that you want Amazon Pinpoint to take if it can't read the
--   required MX record for a custom MAIL FROM domain. When you set this
--   value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value
--   to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't attempt to
--   deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
newtype BehaviorOnMxFailure
BehaviorOnMxFailure' :: Text -> BehaviorOnMxFailure
[fromBehaviorOnMxFailure] :: BehaviorOnMxFailure -> Text
pattern BehaviorOnMxFailure_REJECT_MESSAGE :: BehaviorOnMxFailure
pattern BehaviorOnMxFailure_USE_DEFAULT_VALUE :: BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BehaviorOnMxFailure.BehaviorOnMxFailure

module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.BlacklistEntry

-- | An object that contains information about a blacklisting event that
--   impacts one of the dedicated IP addresses that is associated with your
--   account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlacklistEntry</a> smart constructor.
data BlacklistEntry

-- | The time when the blacklisting event occurred, shown in Unix time
--   format.
[$sel:listingTime:BlacklistEntry'] :: BlacklistEntry -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the blacklist that the IP address appears on.
[$sel:rblName:BlacklistEntry'] :: BlacklistEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Additional information about the blacklisting event, as provided by
--   the blacklist maintainer.
[$sel:description:BlacklistEntry'] :: BlacklistEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BlacklistEntry</a> with all optional fields

--   blacklisting event, as provided by the blacklist maintainer.

--   format.

-- | The name of the blacklist that the IP address appears on.

-- | Additional information about the blacklisting event, as provided by
--   the blacklist maintainer.

module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Content

-- | An object that represents the content of the email, and optionally a
--   character set specification.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContent</a> smart constructor.
data Content
Content' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Content

-- | The character set for the content. Because of the constraints of the
--   SMTP protocol, Amazon Pinpoint uses 7-bit ASCII by default. If the
--   text includes characters outside of the ASCII range, you have to
--   specify a character set. For example, you could specify
--   <tt>UTF-8</tt>, <tt>ISO-8859-1</tt>, or <tt>Shift_JIS</tt>.
[$sel:charset:Content'] :: Content -> Maybe Text

-- | The content of the message itself.
[$sel:data':Content'] :: Content -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Content</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:charset:Content'</a>, <a>content_charset</a> - The character
--   set for the content. Because of the constraints of the SMTP protocol,
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses 7-bit ASCII by default. If the text includes
--   characters outside of the ASCII range, you have to specify a character
--   set. For example, you could specify <tt>UTF-8</tt>,
--   <tt>ISO-8859-1</tt>, or <tt>Shift_JIS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':Content'</a>, <a>content_data</a> - The content of the
--   message itself.
newContent :: Text -> Content

-- | The character set for the content. Because of the constraints of the
--   SMTP protocol, Amazon Pinpoint uses 7-bit ASCII by default. If the
--   text includes characters outside of the ASCII range, you have to
--   specify a character set. For example, you could specify
--   <tt>UTF-8</tt>, <tt>ISO-8859-1</tt>, or <tt>Shift_JIS</tt>.
content_charset :: Lens' Content (Maybe Text)

-- | The content of the message itself.
content_data :: Lens' Content Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Content.Content
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Content.Content

module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Body

-- | Represents the body of the email message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBody</a> smart constructor.
data Body
Body' :: Maybe Content -> Maybe Content -> Body

-- | An object that represents the version of the message that is displayed
--   in email clients that don't support HTML, or clients where the
--   recipient has disabled HTML rendering.
[$sel:text:Body'] :: Body -> Maybe Content

-- | An object that represents the version of the message that is displayed
--   in email clients that support HTML. HTML messages can include
--   formatted text, hyperlinks, images, and more.
[$sel:html:Body'] :: Body -> Maybe Content

--   the version of the message that is displayed in email clients that
--   support HTML. HTML messages can include formatted text, hyperlinks,
--   images, and more.

--   recipient has disabled HTML rendering.

--   in email clients that support HTML. HTML messages can include
--   formatted text, hyperlinks, images, and more.

module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DeliverabilityTestStatus

-- | The status of a predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> operation to view the results of
--   the test.
newtype DeliverabilityTestStatus

[fromDeliverabilityTestStatus] :: DeliverabilityTestStatus -> Text

--   report.

-- | The status of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> to view the results of the test.

module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Destination

-- | An object that describes the recipients for an email.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestination</a> smart constructor.
data Destination
Destination' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Destination

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "BCC" (blind carbon
--   copy) recipients for the email.
[$sel:bccAddresses:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "CC" (carbon copy)
--   recipients for the email.
[$sel:ccAddresses:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "To" recipients for
--   the email.
[$sel:toAddresses:Destination'] :: Destination -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Destination</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bccAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_bccAddresses</a>
--   - An array that contains the email addresses of the "BCC" (blind
--   carbon copy) recipients for the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ccAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_ccAddresses</a> -
--   An array that contains the email addresses of the "CC" (carbon copy)
--   recipients for the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_toAddresses</a> -
--   An array that contains the email addresses of the "To" recipients for
--   the email.
newDestination :: Destination

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "BCC" (blind carbon
--   copy) recipients for the email.
destination_bccAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "CC" (carbon copy)
--   recipients for the email.
destination_ccAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array that contains the email addresses of the "To" recipients for
--   the email.
destination_toAddresses :: Lens' Destination (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Destination.Destination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Destination.Destination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Destination.Destination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Destination.Destination

module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource

-- | The location where Amazon Pinpoint finds the value of a dimension to
--   publish to Amazon CloudWatch. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use the
--   message tags that you specify using an X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS header or a
--   parameter to the SendEmail/SendRawEmail API, choose
--   <tt>messageTag</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use your own email
--   headers, choose <tt>emailHeader</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to
--   use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
newtype DimensionValueSource
DimensionValueSource' :: Text -> DimensionValueSource
[fromDimensionValueSource] :: DimensionValueSource -> Text
pattern DimensionValueSource_EMAIL_HEADER :: DimensionValueSource
pattern DimensionValueSource_LINK_TAG :: DimensionValueSource
pattern DimensionValueSource_MESSAGE_TAG :: DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DimensionValueSource.DimensionValueSource


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | An object that defines the dimension configuration to use when you
--   send Amazon Pinpoint email events to Amazon CloudWatch.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchDimensionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration' :: Text -> DimensionValueSource -> Text -> CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | The name of an Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email
--   sending metric. The name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:dimensionName:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'] :: CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration -> Text

-- | The location where Amazon Pinpoint finds the value of a dimension to
--   publish to Amazon CloudWatch. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use the
--   message tags that you specify using an X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS header or a
--   parameter to the SendEmail/SendRawEmail API, choose
--   <tt>messageTag</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use your own email
--   headers, choose <tt>emailHeader</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to
--   use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
[$sel:dimensionValueSource:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'] :: CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration -> DimensionValueSource

-- | The default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon
--   CloudWatch if you don't provide the value of the dimension when you
--   send an email. This value has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:defaultDimensionValue:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'] :: CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionName</a> - The name of an
--   Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email sending metric.
--   The name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionValueSource:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionValueSource</a> - The
--   location where Amazon Pinpoint finds the value of a dimension to
--   publish to Amazon CloudWatch. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use the
--   message tags that you specify using an X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS header or a
--   parameter to the SendEmail/SendRawEmail API, choose
--   <tt>messageTag</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use your own email
--   headers, choose <tt>emailHeader</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to
--   use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultDimensionValue:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_defaultDimensionValue</a> - The
--   default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon CloudWatch
--   if you don't provide the value of the dimension when you send an
--   email. This value has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newCloudWatchDimensionConfiguration :: Text -> DimensionValueSource -> Text -> CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | The name of an Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email
--   sending metric. The name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionName :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration Text

-- | The location where Amazon Pinpoint finds the value of a dimension to
--   publish to Amazon CloudWatch. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use the
--   message tags that you specify using an X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS header or a
--   parameter to the SendEmail/SendRawEmail API, choose
--   <tt>messageTag</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use your own email
--   headers, choose <tt>emailHeader</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to
--   use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionValueSource :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration DimensionValueSource

-- | The default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon
--   CloudWatch if you don't provide the value of the dimension when you
--   send an email. This value has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_defaultDimensionValue :: Lens' CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration.CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchDestination</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchDestination
CloudWatchDestination' :: [CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration] -> CloudWatchDestination

-- | An array of objects that define the dimensions to use when you send
--   email events to Amazon CloudWatch.
[$sel:dimensionConfigurations:CloudWatchDestination'] :: CloudWatchDestination -> [CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration]

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionConfigurations:CloudWatchDestination'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDestination_dimensionConfigurations</a> - An array of
--   objects that define the dimensions to use when you send email events
--   to Amazon CloudWatch.
newCloudWatchDestination :: CloudWatchDestination

-- | An array of objects that define the dimensions to use when you send
--   email events to Amazon CloudWatch.
cloudWatchDestination_dimensionConfigurations :: Lens' CloudWatchDestination [CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.CloudWatchDestination.CloudWatchDestination


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus

-- | The DKIM authentication status of the identity. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – The DKIM verification process was initiated,
--   and Amazon Pinpoint is still waiting for the required CNAME records to
--   appear in the DNS configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – The DKIM authentication process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – The DKIM authentication process failed. This can
--   happen when Amazon Pinpoint fails to find the required CNAME records
--   in the DNS configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon Pinpoint from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt> – The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype DkimStatus
DkimStatus' :: Text -> DkimStatus
[fromDkimStatus] :: DkimStatus -> Text
pattern DkimStatus_FAILED :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_NOT_STARTED :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_PENDING :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_SUCCESS :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_TEMPORARY_FAILURE :: DkimStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimStatus.DkimStatus


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimAttributes

-- | An object that contains information about the DKIM configuration for
--   an email identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDkimAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data DkimAttributes
DkimAttributes' :: Maybe DkimStatus -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> DkimAttributes

-- | Describes whether or not Amazon Pinpoint has successfully located the
--   DKIM records in the DNS records for the domain. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't yet located the DKIM
--   records in the DNS configuration for the domain, but will continue to
--   attempt to locate them.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint located the DKIM records in the
--   DNS configuration for the domain and determined that they're correct.
--   Amazon Pinpoint can now send DKIM-signed email from the identity.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint was unable to locate the DKIM
--   records in the DNS settings for the domain, and won't continue to
--   search for them.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the DKIM status for the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't yet started
--   searching for the DKIM records in the DKIM records for the
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:DkimAttributes'] :: DkimAttributes -> Maybe DkimStatus

-- | A set of unique strings that you use to create a set of CNAME records
--   that you add to the DNS configuration for your domain. When Amazon
--   Pinpoint detects these records in the DNS configuration for your
--   domain, the DKIM authentication process is complete. Amazon Pinpoint
--   usually detects these records within about 72 hours of adding them to
--   the DNS configuration for your domain.
[$sel:tokens:DkimAttributes'] :: DkimAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint
--   sends from the identity are DKIM-signed. If the value is
--   <tt>false</tt>, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends from the
--   identity aren't DKIM-signed.
[$sel:signingEnabled:DkimAttributes'] :: DkimAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>DkimAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DkimAttributes'</a>, <a>dkimAttributes_status</a> -
--   Describes whether or not Amazon Pinpoint has successfully located the
--   DKIM records in the DNS records for the domain. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't yet located the DKIM
--   records in the DNS configuration for the domain, but will continue to
--   attempt to locate them.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint located the DKIM records in the
--   DNS configuration for the domain and determined that they're correct.
--   Amazon Pinpoint can now send DKIM-signed email from the identity.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint was unable to locate the DKIM
--   records in the DNS settings for the domain, and won't continue to
--   search for them.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the DKIM status for the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't yet started
--   searching for the DKIM records in the DKIM records for the
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokens:DkimAttributes'</a>, <a>dkimAttributes_tokens</a> - A
--   set of unique strings that you use to create a set of CNAME records
--   that you add to the DNS configuration for your domain. When Amazon
--   Pinpoint detects these records in the DNS configuration for your
--   domain, the DKIM authentication process is complete. Amazon Pinpoint
--   usually detects these records within about 72 hours of adding them to
--   the DNS configuration for your domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingEnabled:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_signingEnabled</a> - If the value is <tt>true</tt>,
--   then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends from the identity are
--   DKIM-signed. If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then the messages that
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.
newDkimAttributes :: DkimAttributes

-- | Describes whether or not Amazon Pinpoint has successfully located the
--   DKIM records in the DNS records for the domain. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't yet located the DKIM
--   records in the DNS configuration for the domain, but will continue to
--   attempt to locate them.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint located the DKIM records in the
--   DNS configuration for the domain and determined that they're correct.
--   Amazon Pinpoint can now send DKIM-signed email from the identity.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint was unable to locate the DKIM
--   records in the DNS settings for the domain, and won't continue to
--   search for them.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the DKIM status for the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't yet started
--   searching for the DKIM records in the DKIM records for the
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
dkimAttributes_status :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe DkimStatus)

-- | A set of unique strings that you use to create a set of CNAME records
--   that you add to the DNS configuration for your domain. When Amazon
--   Pinpoint detects these records in the DNS configuration for your
--   domain, the DKIM authentication process is complete. Amazon Pinpoint
--   usually detects these records within about 72 hours of adding them to
--   the DNS configuration for your domain.
dkimAttributes_tokens :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe [Text])

-- | If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint
--   sends from the identity are DKIM-signed. If the value is
--   <tt>false</tt>, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends from the
--   identity aren't DKIM-signed.
dkimAttributes_signingEnabled :: Lens' DkimAttributes (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimAttributes.DkimAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimAttributes.DkimAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimAttributes.DkimAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimAttributes.DkimAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimAttributes.DkimAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimAttributes.DkimAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DkimAttributes.DkimAttributes


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign

-- | An object that contains the deliverability data for a specific
--   campaign. This data is available for a campaign only if the campaign
--   sent email by using a domain that the Deliverability dashboard is
--   enabled for (<tt>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</tt> operation).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainDeliverabilityCampaign</a> smart constructor.
data DomainDeliverabilityCampaign
DomainDeliverabilityCampaign' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe POSIX -> DomainDeliverabilityCampaign

-- | The number of email messages that were delivered to recipients' spam
--   or junk mail folders.
[$sel:spamCount:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Integer

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email message.
[$sel:subject:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | The major email providers who handled the email message.
[$sel:esps:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The verified email address that the email message was sent from.
[$sel:fromAddress:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of email messages that were deleted by recipients,
--   without being opened first. Due to technical limitations, this value
--   only includes recipients who opened the message by using an email
--   client that supports images.
[$sel:deleteRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Double

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign. Amazon Pinpoint automatically
--   generates and assigns this identifier to a campaign. This value is not
--   the same as the campaign identifier that Amazon Pinpoint assigns to
--   campaigns that you create and manage by using the Amazon Pinpoint API
--   or the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:campaignId:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP addresses that were used to send the email message.
[$sel:sendingIps:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The first time, in Unix time format, when the email message was
--   delivered to any recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine
--   how long it took for a campaign to deliver an email message.
[$sel:firstSeenDateTime:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The number of email messages that were delivered to recipients’
--   inboxes.
[$sel:inboxCount:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Integer

-- | The percentage of email messages that were opened and then deleted by
--   recipients. Due to technical limitations, this value only includes
--   recipients who opened the message by using an email client that
--   supports images.
[$sel:readDeleteRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Double

-- | The projected number of recipients that the email message was sent to.
[$sel:projectedVolume:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Integer

-- | The URL of an image that contains a snapshot of the email message that
--   was sent.
[$sel:imageUrl:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of email messages that were opened by recipients. Due
--   to technical limitations, this value only includes recipients who
--   opened the message by using an email client that supports images.
[$sel:readRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe Double

-- | The last time, in Unix time format, when the email message was
--   delivered to any recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine
--   how long it took for a campaign to deliver an email message.
[$sel:lastSeenDateTime:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainDeliverabilityCampaign</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamCount:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_spamCount</a> - The number of email
--   messages that were delivered to recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_subject</a> - The subject line, or
--   title, of the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:esps:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_esps</a> - The major email providers
--   who handled the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_fromAddress</a> - The verified email
--   address that the email message was sent from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_deleteRate</a> - The percentage of
--   email messages that were deleted by recipients, without being opened
--   first. Due to technical limitations, this value only includes
--   recipients who opened the message by using an email client that
--   supports images.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignId:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_campaignId</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the campaign. Amazon Pinpoint automatically generates and assigns
--   this identifier to a campaign. This value is not the same as the
--   campaign identifier that Amazon Pinpoint assigns to campaigns that you
--   create and manage by using the Amazon Pinpoint API or the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingIps:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_sendingIps</a> - The IP addresses that
--   were used to send the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firstSeenDateTime:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_firstSeenDateTime</a> - The first
--   time, in Unix time format, when the email message was delivered to any
--   recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine how long it took
--   for a campaign to deliver an email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxCount:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_inboxCount</a> - The number of email
--   messages that were delivered to recipients’ inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readDeleteRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_readDeleteRate</a> - The percentage of
--   email messages that were opened and then deleted by recipients. Due to
--   technical limitations, this value only includes recipients who opened
--   the message by using an email client that supports images.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedVolume:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_projectedVolume</a> - The projected
--   number of recipients that the email message was sent to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_imageUrl</a> - The URL of an image
--   that contains a snapshot of the email message that was sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_readRate</a> - The percentage of email
--   messages that were opened by recipients. Due to technical limitations,
--   this value only includes recipients who opened the message by using an
--   email client that supports images.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSeenDateTime:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_lastSeenDateTime</a> - The last time,
--   in Unix time format, when the email message was delivered to any
--   recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine how long it took
--   for a campaign to deliver an email message.
newDomainDeliverabilityCampaign :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign

-- | The number of email messages that were delivered to recipients' spam
--   or junk mail folders.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_spamCount :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Integer)

-- | The subject line, or title, of the email message.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_subject :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Text)

-- | The major email providers who handled the email message.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_esps :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe [Text])

-- | The verified email address that the email message was sent from.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_fromAddress :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of email messages that were deleted by recipients,
--   without being opened first. Due to technical limitations, this value
--   only includes recipients who opened the message by using an email
--   client that supports images.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_deleteRate :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Double)

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign. Amazon Pinpoint automatically
--   generates and assigns this identifier to a campaign. This value is not
--   the same as the campaign identifier that Amazon Pinpoint assigns to
--   campaigns that you create and manage by using the Amazon Pinpoint API
--   or the Amazon Pinpoint console.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_campaignId :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP addresses that were used to send the email message.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_sendingIps :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe [Text])

-- | The first time, in Unix time format, when the email message was
--   delivered to any recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine
--   how long it took for a campaign to deliver an email message.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_firstSeenDateTime :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The number of email messages that were delivered to recipients’
--   inboxes.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_inboxCount :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Integer)

-- | The percentage of email messages that were opened and then deleted by
--   recipients. Due to technical limitations, this value only includes
--   recipients who opened the message by using an email client that
--   supports images.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_readDeleteRate :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Double)

-- | The projected number of recipients that the email message was sent to.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_projectedVolume :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Integer)

-- | The URL of an image that contains a snapshot of the email message that
--   was sent.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_imageUrl :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of email messages that were opened by recipients. Due
--   to technical limitations, this value only includes recipients who
--   opened the message by using an email client that supports images.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_readRate :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe Double)

-- | The last time, in Unix time format, when the email message was
--   delivered to any recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine
--   how long it took for a campaign to deliver an email message.
domainDeliverabilityCampaign_lastSeenDateTime :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityCampaign (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign.DomainDeliverabilityCampaign


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainIspPlacement

-- | An object that contains inbox placement data for email sent from one
--   of your email domains to a specific email provider.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainIspPlacement</a> smart constructor.
data DomainIspPlacement
DomainIspPlacement' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> DomainIspPlacement

-- | The percentage of messages that were sent from the selected domain to
--   the specified email provider that arrived in recipients' spam or junk
--   mail folders.
[$sel:spamPercentage:DomainIspPlacement'] :: DomainIspPlacement -> Maybe Double

-- | The total number of messages that were sent from the selected domain
--   to the specified email provider that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
[$sel:inboxRawCount:DomainIspPlacement'] :: DomainIspPlacement -> Maybe Integer

-- | The name of the email provider that the inbox placement data applies
--   to.
[$sel:ispName:DomainIspPlacement'] :: DomainIspPlacement -> Maybe Text

-- | The percentage of messages that were sent from the selected domain to
--   the specified email provider that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
[$sel:inboxPercentage:DomainIspPlacement'] :: DomainIspPlacement -> Maybe Double

-- | The total number of messages that were sent from the selected domain
--   to the specified email provider that arrived in recipients' spam or
--   junk mail folders.
[$sel:spamRawCount:DomainIspPlacement'] :: DomainIspPlacement -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainIspPlacement</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamPercentage:DomainIspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>domainIspPlacement_spamPercentage</a> - The percentage of messages
--   that were sent from the selected domain to the specified email
--   provider that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxRawCount:DomainIspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>domainIspPlacement_inboxRawCount</a> - The total number of messages
--   that were sent from the selected domain to the specified email
--   provider that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ispName:DomainIspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>domainIspPlacement_ispName</a> - The name of the email provider
--   that the inbox placement data applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxPercentage:DomainIspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>domainIspPlacement_inboxPercentage</a> - The percentage of messages
--   that were sent from the selected domain to the specified email
--   provider that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamRawCount:DomainIspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>domainIspPlacement_spamRawCount</a> - The total number of messages
--   that were sent from the selected domain to the specified email
--   provider that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
newDomainIspPlacement :: DomainIspPlacement

-- | The percentage of messages that were sent from the selected domain to
--   the specified email provider that arrived in recipients' spam or junk
--   mail folders.
domainIspPlacement_spamPercentage :: Lens' DomainIspPlacement (Maybe Double)

-- | The total number of messages that were sent from the selected domain
--   to the specified email provider that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
domainIspPlacement_inboxRawCount :: Lens' DomainIspPlacement (Maybe Integer)

-- | The name of the email provider that the inbox placement data applies
--   to.
domainIspPlacement_ispName :: Lens' DomainIspPlacement (Maybe Text)

-- | The percentage of messages that were sent from the selected domain to
--   the specified email provider that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
domainIspPlacement_inboxPercentage :: Lens' DomainIspPlacement (Maybe Double)

-- | The total number of messages that were sent from the selected domain
--   to the specified email provider that arrived in recipients' spam or
--   junk mail folders.
domainIspPlacement_spamRawCount :: Lens' DomainIspPlacement (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainIspPlacement.DomainIspPlacement
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainIspPlacement.DomainIspPlacement
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainIspPlacement.DomainIspPlacement
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainIspPlacement.DomainIspPlacement
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainIspPlacement.DomainIspPlacement
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainIspPlacement.DomainIspPlacement
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainIspPlacement.DomainIspPlacement


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType

-- | An email sending event type. For example, email sends, opens, and
--   bounces are all email events.
newtype EventType
EventType' :: Text -> EventType
[fromEventType] :: EventType -> Text
pattern EventType_BOUNCE :: EventType
pattern EventType_CLICK :: EventType
pattern EventType_COMPLAINT :: EventType
pattern EventType_DELIVERY :: EventType
pattern EventType_OPEN :: EventType
pattern EventType_REJECT :: EventType
pattern EventType_RENDERING_FAILURE :: EventType
pattern EventType_SEND :: EventType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventType.EventType


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType

-- | The email identity type. The identity type can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>EMAIL_ADDRESS</tt> – The identity is an email address.</li>
--   <li><tt>DOMAIN</tt> – The identity is a domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype IdentityType
IdentityType' :: Text -> IdentityType
[fromIdentityType] :: IdentityType -> Text
pattern IdentityType_DOMAIN :: IdentityType
pattern IdentityType_EMAIL_ADDRESS :: IdentityType
pattern IdentityType_MANAGED_DOMAIN :: IdentityType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityType.IdentityType


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityInfo

-- | Information about an email identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdentityInfo</a> smart constructor.
data IdentityInfo
IdentityInfo' :: Maybe IdentityType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> IdentityInfo

-- | The email identity type. The identity type can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>EMAIL_ADDRESS</tt> – The identity is an email address.</li>
--   <li><tt>DOMAIN</tt> – The identity is a domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>MANAGED_DOMAIN</tt> – The identity is a domain that is managed
--   by AWS.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:identityType:IdentityInfo'] :: IdentityInfo -> Maybe IdentityType

-- | The address or domain of the identity.
[$sel:identityName:IdentityInfo'] :: IdentityInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether or not you can send email from the identity.
--   
--   In Amazon Pinpoint, an identity is an email address or domain that you
--   send email from. Before you can send email from an identity, you have
--   to demostrate that you own the identity, and that you authorize Amazon
--   Pinpoint to send email from that identity.
[$sel:sendingEnabled:IdentityInfo'] :: IdentityInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>IdentityInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityType:IdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>identityInfo_identityType</a> - The email identity type. The
--   identity type can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>EMAIL_ADDRESS</tt> – The identity is an email address.</li>
--   <li><tt>DOMAIN</tt> – The identity is a domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>MANAGED_DOMAIN</tt> – The identity is a domain that is managed
--   by AWS.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityName:IdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>identityInfo_identityName</a> - The address or domain of the
--   identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingEnabled:IdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>identityInfo_sendingEnabled</a> - Indicates whether or not you can
--   send email from the identity.
--   
--   In Amazon Pinpoint, an identity is an email address or domain that you
--   send email from. Before you can send email from an identity, you have
--   to demostrate that you own the identity, and that you authorize Amazon
--   Pinpoint to send email from that identity.
newIdentityInfo :: IdentityInfo

-- | The email identity type. The identity type can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>EMAIL_ADDRESS</tt> – The identity is an email address.</li>
--   <li><tt>DOMAIN</tt> – The identity is a domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>MANAGED_DOMAIN</tt> – The identity is a domain that is managed
--   by AWS.</li>
--   </ul>
identityInfo_identityType :: Lens' IdentityInfo (Maybe IdentityType)

-- | The address or domain of the identity.
identityInfo_identityName :: Lens' IdentityInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether or not you can send email from the identity.
--   
--   In Amazon Pinpoint, an identity is an email address or domain that you
--   send email from. Before you can send email from an identity, you have
--   to demostrate that you own the identity, and that you authorize Amazon
--   Pinpoint to send email from that identity.
identityInfo_sendingEnabled :: Lens' IdentityInfo (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityInfo.IdentityInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityInfo.IdentityInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityInfo.IdentityInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityInfo.IdentityInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityInfo.IdentityInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityInfo.IdentityInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IdentityInfo.IdentityInfo


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.InboxPlacementTrackingOption

-- | An object that contains information about the inbox placement data
--   settings for a verified domain that’s associated with your AWS
--   account. This data is available only if you enabled the Deliverability
--   dashboard for the domain (<tt>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</tt>
--   operation).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInboxPlacementTrackingOption</a> smart constructor.
data InboxPlacementTrackingOption
InboxPlacementTrackingOption' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> InboxPlacementTrackingOption

-- | An array of strings, one for each major email provider that the inbox
--   placement data applies to.
[$sel:trackedIsps:InboxPlacementTrackingOption'] :: InboxPlacementTrackingOption -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies whether inbox placement data is being tracked for the
--   domain.
[$sel:global:InboxPlacementTrackingOption'] :: InboxPlacementTrackingOption -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>InboxPlacementTrackingOption</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:trackedIsps:InboxPlacementTrackingOption'</a>,
--   <a>inboxPlacementTrackingOption_trackedIsps</a> - An array of strings,
--   one for each major email provider that the inbox placement data
--   applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:global:InboxPlacementTrackingOption'</a>,
--   <a>inboxPlacementTrackingOption_global</a> - Specifies whether inbox
--   placement data is being tracked for the domain.
newInboxPlacementTrackingOption :: InboxPlacementTrackingOption

-- | An array of strings, one for each major email provider that the inbox
--   placement data applies to.
inboxPlacementTrackingOption_trackedIsps :: Lens' InboxPlacementTrackingOption (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies whether inbox placement data is being tracked for the
--   domain.
inboxPlacementTrackingOption_global :: Lens' InboxPlacementTrackingOption (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.InboxPlacementTrackingOption.InboxPlacementTrackingOption
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.InboxPlacementTrackingOption.InboxPlacementTrackingOption
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.InboxPlacementTrackingOption.InboxPlacementTrackingOption
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.InboxPlacementTrackingOption.InboxPlacementTrackingOption
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.InboxPlacementTrackingOption.InboxPlacementTrackingOption
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.InboxPlacementTrackingOption.InboxPlacementTrackingOption
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.InboxPlacementTrackingOption.InboxPlacementTrackingOption
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.InboxPlacementTrackingOption.InboxPlacementTrackingOption


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption

-- | An object that contains information about the Deliverability dashboard
--   subscription for a verified domain that you use to send email and
--   currently has an active Deliverability dashboard subscription. If a
--   Deliverability dashboard subscription is active for a domain, you gain
--   access to reputation, inbox placement, and other metrics for the
--   domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption
DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe InboxPlacementTrackingOption -> DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption

-- | A verified domain that’s associated with your AWS account and
--   currently has an active Deliverability dashboard subscription.
[$sel:domain:DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption'] :: DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption -> Maybe Text

-- | The date, in Unix time format, when you enabled the Deliverability
--   dashboard for the domain.
[$sel:subscriptionStartDate:DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption'] :: DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that contains information about the inbox placement data
--   settings for the domain.
[$sel:inboxPlacementTrackingOption:DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption'] :: DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption -> Maybe InboxPlacementTrackingOption

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityTrackingOption_domain</a> - A verified domain
--   that’s associated with your AWS account and currently has an active
--   Deliverability dashboard subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionStartDate:DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityTrackingOption_subscriptionStartDate</a> - The
--   date, in Unix time format, when you enabled the Deliverability
--   dashboard for the domain.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxPlacementTrackingOption:DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityTrackingOption_inboxPlacementTrackingOption</a>
--   - An object that contains information about the inbox placement data
--   settings for the domain.
newDomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption :: DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption

-- | A verified domain that’s associated with your AWS account and
--   currently has an active Deliverability dashboard subscription.
domainDeliverabilityTrackingOption_domain :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption (Maybe Text)

-- | The date, in Unix time format, when you enabled the Deliverability
--   dashboard for the domain.
domainDeliverabilityTrackingOption_subscriptionStartDate :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that contains information about the inbox placement data
--   settings for the domain.
domainDeliverabilityTrackingOption_inboxPlacementTrackingOption :: Lens' DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption (Maybe InboxPlacementTrackingOption)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption.DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisFirehoseDestination</a> smart constructor.
data KinesisFirehoseDestination
KinesisFirehoseDestination' :: Text -> Text -> KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that Amazon Pinpoint
--   uses when sending email events to the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   stream.
[$sel:iamRoleArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'] :: KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   stream that Amazon Pinpoint sends email events to.
[$sel:deliveryStreamArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'] :: KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisFirehoseDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisFirehoseDestination_iamRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role that Amazon Pinpoint uses when sending
--   email events to the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose stream that
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends email events to.
newKinesisFirehoseDestination :: Text -> Text -> KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that Amazon Pinpoint
--   uses when sending email events to the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   stream.
kinesisFirehoseDestination_iamRoleArn :: Lens' KinesisFirehoseDestination Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
--   stream that Amazon Pinpoint sends email events to.
kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamArn :: Lens' KinesisFirehoseDestination Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.KinesisFirehoseDestination.KinesisFirehoseDestination


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't started searching for
--   the MX record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint detected the required MX record
--   for the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint can't find the required MX
--   record, or the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype MailFromDomainStatus
MailFromDomainStatus' :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus
[fromMailFromDomainStatus] :: MailFromDomainStatus -> Text
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_FAILED :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_PENDING :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_SUCCESS :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_TEMPORARY_FAILURE :: MailFromDomainStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromDomainStatus.MailFromDomainStatus


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromAttributes

-- | A list of attributes that are associated with a MAIL FROM domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMailFromAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data MailFromAttributes
MailFromAttributes' :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus -> BehaviorOnMxFailure -> MailFromAttributes

-- | The name of a domain that an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM
--   domain.
[$sel:mailFromDomain:MailFromAttributes'] :: MailFromAttributes -> Text

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't started searching for
--   the MX record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint detected the required MX record
--   for the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint can't find the required MX
--   record, or the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:mailFromDomainStatus:MailFromAttributes'] :: MailFromAttributes -> MailFromDomainStatus

-- | The action that Amazon Pinpoint to takes if it can't read the required
--   MX record for a custom MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to
--   <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint uses <i>amazonses.com</i> as
--   the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to
--   <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't attempt to
--   deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
[$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:MailFromAttributes'] :: MailFromAttributes -> BehaviorOnMxFailure

-- | Create a value of <a>MailFromAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomain:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain</a> - The name of a domain that
--   an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomainStatus:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomainStatus</a> - The status of the
--   MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't started searching for
--   the MX record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint detected the required MX record
--   for the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint can't find the required MX
--   record, or the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure</a> - The action that Amazon
--   Pinpoint to takes if it can't read the required MX record for a custom
--   MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>,
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain.
--   When you set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint
--   returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
newMailFromAttributes :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus -> BehaviorOnMxFailure -> MailFromAttributes

-- | The name of a domain that an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM
--   domain.
mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain :: Lens' MailFromAttributes Text

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't started searching for
--   the MX record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint detected the required MX record
--   for the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint can't find the required MX
--   record, or the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomainStatus :: Lens' MailFromAttributes MailFromDomainStatus

-- | The action that Amazon Pinpoint to takes if it can't read the required
--   MX record for a custom MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to
--   <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint uses <i>amazonses.com</i> as
--   the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to
--   <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't attempt to
--   deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
mailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure :: Lens' MailFromAttributes BehaviorOnMxFailure
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MailFromAttributes.MailFromAttributes


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Message

-- | Represents the email message that you're sending. The <tt>Message</tt>
--   object consists of a subject line and a message body.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessage</a> smart constructor.
data Message
Message' :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | The subject line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit
--   ASCII characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
[$sel:subject:Message'] :: Message -> Content

-- | The body of the message. You can specify an HTML version of the
--   message, a text-only version of the message, or both.
[$sel:body:Message'] :: Message -> Body

-- | Create a value of <a>Message</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:Message'</a>, <a>message_subject</a> - The subject
--   line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit ASCII
--   characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
