--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:Message'</a>, <a>message_body</a> - The body of the
--   message. You can specify an HTML version of the message, a text-only
--   version of the message, or both.
newMessage :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | The subject line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit
--   ASCII characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
message_subject :: Lens' Message Content

-- | The body of the message. You can specify an HTML version of the
--   message, a text-only version of the message, or both.
message_body :: Lens' Message Body
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Message.Message
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Message.Message
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Message.Message
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Message.Message
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Message.Message
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Message.Message
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Message.Message


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MessageTag

-- | Contains the name and value of a tag that you apply to an email. You
--   can use message tags when you publish email sending events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageTag</a> smart constructor.
data MessageTag
MessageTag' :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | The name of the message tag. The message tag name has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a–z, A–Z), numbers (0–9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:name:MessageTag'] :: MessageTag -> Text

-- | The value of the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a–z, A–Z), numbers (0–9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:value:MessageTag'] :: MessageTag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageTag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_name</a> - The name of the
--   message tag. The message tag name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a–z, A–Z), numbers (0–9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_value</a> - The value of
--   the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the following
--   criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a–z, A–Z), numbers (0–9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newMessageTag :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | The name of the message tag. The message tag name has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a–z, A–Z), numbers (0–9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
messageTag_name :: Lens' MessageTag Text

-- | The value of the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the
--   following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a–z, A–Z), numbers (0–9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
messageTag_value :: Lens' MessageTag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.MessageTag.MessageTag


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PinpointDestination

-- | An object that defines a Amazon Pinpoint destination for email events.
--   You can use Amazon Pinpoint events to create attributes in Amazon
--   Pinpoint projects. You can use these attributes to create segments for
--   your campaigns.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPinpointDestination</a> smart constructor.
data PinpointDestination
PinpointDestination' :: Maybe Text -> PinpointDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Pinpoint project that you
--   want to send email events to.
[$sel:applicationArn:PinpointDestination'] :: PinpointDestination -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PinpointDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:applicationArn:PinpointDestination'</a>,
--   <a>pinpointDestination_applicationArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the Amazon Pinpoint project that you want to send email
--   events to.
newPinpointDestination :: PinpointDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Pinpoint project that you
--   want to send email events to.
pinpointDestination_applicationArn :: Lens' PinpointDestination (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PinpointDestination.PinpointDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PinpointDestination.PinpointDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PinpointDestination.PinpointDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PinpointDestination.PinpointDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PinpointDestination.PinpointDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PinpointDestination.PinpointDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PinpointDestination.PinpointDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PinpointDestination.PinpointDestination


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PlacementStatistics

-- | An object that contains inbox placement data for an email provider.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlacementStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data PlacementStatistics
PlacementStatistics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> PlacementStatistics

-- | The percentage of emails that didn't arrive in recipients' inboxes at
--   all during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:missingPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail
--   folders during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:spamPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using Sender
--   Policy Framework (SPF) during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:spfPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using DomainKeys
--   Identified Mail (DKIM) during the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:dkimPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes during
--   the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:inboxPercentage:PlacementStatistics'] :: PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>PlacementStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_missingPercentage</a> - The percentage of
--   emails that didn't arrive in recipients' inboxes at all during the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_spamPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail folders during the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spfPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_spfPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that were authenticated by using Sender Policy Framework (SPF) during
--   the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dkimPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_dkimPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that were authenticated by using DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM)
--   during the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_inboxPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that arrived in recipients' inboxes during the predictive inbox
--   placement test.
newPlacementStatistics :: PlacementStatistics

-- | The percentage of emails that didn't arrive in recipients' inboxes at
--   all during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_missingPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail
--   folders during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_spamPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using Sender
--   Policy Framework (SPF) during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_spfPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that were authenticated by using DomainKeys
--   Identified Mail (DKIM) during the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_dkimPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)

-- | The percentage of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes during
--   the predictive inbox placement test.
placementStatistics_inboxPercentage :: Lens' PlacementStatistics (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.PlacementStatistics.PlacementStatistics


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IspPlacement

-- | An object that describes how email sent during the predictive inbox
--   placement test was handled by a certain email provider.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIspPlacement</a> smart constructor.
data IspPlacement
IspPlacement' :: Maybe PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Text -> IspPlacement

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific email
--   provider.
[$sel:placementStatistics:IspPlacement'] :: IspPlacement -> Maybe PlacementStatistics

-- | The name of the email provider that the inbox placement data applies
--   to.
[$sel:ispName:IspPlacement'] :: IspPlacement -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>IspPlacement</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:placementStatistics:IspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>ispPlacement_placementStatistics</a> - An object that contains
--   inbox placement metrics for a specific email provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ispName:IspPlacement'</a>, <a>ispPlacement_ispName</a> - The
--   name of the email provider that the inbox placement data applies to.
newIspPlacement :: IspPlacement

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific email
--   provider.
ispPlacement_placementStatistics :: Lens' IspPlacement (Maybe PlacementStatistics)

-- | The name of the email provider that the inbox placement data applies
--   to.
ispPlacement_ispName :: Lens' IspPlacement (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IspPlacement.IspPlacement
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IspPlacement.IspPlacement
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IspPlacement.IspPlacement
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IspPlacement.IspPlacement
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IspPlacement.IspPlacement
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IspPlacement.IspPlacement
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.IspPlacement.IspPlacement


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.RawMessage

-- | The raw email message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRawMessage</a> smart constructor.
data RawMessage
RawMessage' :: Base64 -> RawMessage

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that Amazon Pinpoint
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:data':RawMessage'] :: RawMessage -> Base64

-- | Create a value of <a>RawMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':RawMessage'</a>, <a>rawMessage_data</a> - The raw email
--   message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that Amazon Pinpoint
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC
--   5321</a>.--</li>
--   <li>- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data.</li>
--   <li>- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation
--   during</li>
--   <li>- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation.</li>
--   <li>- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw unencoded
--   data.</li>
--   </ul>
newRawMessage :: ByteString -> RawMessage

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that Amazon Pinpoint
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC
--   5321</a>.--</li>
--   <li>- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data.</li>
--   <li>- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation
--   during</li>
--   <li>- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation.</li>
--   <li>- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw unencoded
--   data.</li>
--   </ul>
rawMessage_data :: Lens' RawMessage ByteString
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.RawMessage.RawMessage


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.ReputationOptions

-- | Enable or disable collection of reputation metrics for emails that you
--   send using this configuration set in the current AWS Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReputationOptions</a> smart constructor.
data ReputationOptions
ReputationOptions' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> ReputationOptions

-- | The date and time (in Unix time) when the reputation metrics were last
--   given a fresh start. When your account is given a fresh start, your
--   reputation metrics are calculated starting from the date of the fresh
--   start.
[$sel:lastFreshStart:ReputationOptions'] :: ReputationOptions -> Maybe POSIX

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the
--   configuration set. If <tt>false</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics
--   is disabled for the configuration set.
[$sel:reputationMetricsEnabled:ReputationOptions'] :: ReputationOptions -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ReputationOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFreshStart:ReputationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>reputationOptions_lastFreshStart</a> - The date and time (in Unix
--   time) when the reputation metrics were last given a fresh start. When
--   your account is given a fresh start, your reputation metrics are
--   calculated starting from the date of the fresh start.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reputationMetricsEnabled:ReputationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>reputationOptions_reputationMetricsEnabled</a> - If <tt>true</tt>,
--   tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the configuration set.
--   If <tt>false</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics is disabled for the
--   configuration set.
newReputationOptions :: ReputationOptions

-- | The date and time (in Unix time) when the reputation metrics were last
--   given a fresh start. When your account is given a fresh start, your
--   reputation metrics are calculated starting from the date of the fresh
--   start.
reputationOptions_lastFreshStart :: Lens' ReputationOptions (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the
--   configuration set. If <tt>false</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics
--   is disabled for the configuration set.
reputationOptions_reputationMetricsEnabled :: Lens' ReputationOptions (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.ReputationOptions.ReputationOptions


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendQuota

-- | An object that contains information about the per-day and per-second
--   sending limits for your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS
--   Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendQuota</a> smart constructor.
data SendQuota
SendQuota' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> SendQuota

-- | The maximum number of emails that you can send per second in the
--   current AWS Region. This value is also called your <i>maximum sending
--   rate</i> or your <i>maximum TPS (transactions per second) rate</i>.
[$sel:maxSendRate:SendQuota'] :: SendQuota -> Maybe Double

-- | The number of emails sent from your Amazon Pinpoint account in the
--   current AWS Region over the past 24 hours.
[$sel:sentLast24Hours:SendQuota'] :: SendQuota -> Maybe Double

-- | The maximum number of emails that you can send in the current AWS
--   Region over a 24-hour period. This value is also called your
--   <i>sending quota</i>.
[$sel:max24HourSend:SendQuota'] :: SendQuota -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>SendQuota</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxSendRate:SendQuota'</a>, <a>sendQuota_maxSendRate</a> - The
--   maximum number of emails that you can send per second in the current
--   AWS Region. This value is also called your <i>maximum sending rate</i>
--   or your <i>maximum TPS (transactions per second) rate</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentLast24Hours:SendQuota'</a>,
--   <a>sendQuota_sentLast24Hours</a> - The number of emails sent from your
--   Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region over the past 24
--   hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:max24HourSend:SendQuota'</a>, <a>sendQuota_max24HourSend</a> -
--   The maximum number of emails that you can send in the current AWS
--   Region over a 24-hour period. This value is also called your
--   <i>sending quota</i>.
newSendQuota :: SendQuota

-- | The maximum number of emails that you can send per second in the
--   current AWS Region. This value is also called your <i>maximum sending
--   rate</i> or your <i>maximum TPS (transactions per second) rate</i>.
sendQuota_maxSendRate :: Lens' SendQuota (Maybe Double)

-- | The number of emails sent from your Amazon Pinpoint account in the
--   current AWS Region over the past 24 hours.
sendQuota_sentLast24Hours :: Lens' SendQuota (Maybe Double)

-- | The maximum number of emails that you can send in the current AWS
--   Region over a 24-hour period. This value is also called your
--   <i>sending quota</i>.
sendQuota_max24HourSend :: Lens' SendQuota (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendQuota.SendQuota


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendingOptions

-- | Used to enable or disable email sending for messages that use this
--   configuration set in the current AWS Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendingOptions</a> smart constructor.
data SendingOptions
SendingOptions' :: Maybe Bool -> SendingOptions

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, email sending is enabled for the configuration set.
--   If <tt>false</tt>, email sending is disabled for the configuration
--   set.
[$sel:sendingEnabled:SendingOptions'] :: SendingOptions -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>SendingOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingEnabled:SendingOptions'</a>,
--   <a>sendingOptions_sendingEnabled</a> - If <tt>true</tt>, email sending
--   is enabled for the configuration set. If <tt>false</tt>, email sending
--   is disabled for the configuration set.
newSendingOptions :: SendingOptions

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, email sending is enabled for the configuration set.
--   If <tt>false</tt>, email sending is disabled for the configuration
--   set.
sendingOptions_sendingEnabled :: Lens' SendingOptions (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendingOptions.SendingOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendingOptions.SendingOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendingOptions.SendingOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendingOptions.SendingOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendingOptions.SendingOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendingOptions.SendingOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendingOptions.SendingOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SendingOptions.SendingOptions


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SnsDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnsDestination</a> smart constructor.
data SnsDestination
SnsDestination' :: Text -> SnsDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic that you want
--   to publish email events to. For more information about Amazon SNS
--   topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:topicArn:SnsDestination'] :: SnsDestination -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SnsDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:SnsDestination'</a>, <a>snsDestination_topicArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic that you want
--   to publish email events to. For more information about Amazon SNS
--   topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer Guide</a>.
newSnsDestination :: Text -> SnsDestination

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic that you want
--   to publish email events to. For more information about Amazon SNS
--   topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer Guide</a>.
snsDestination_topicArn :: Lens' SnsDestination Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SnsDestination.SnsDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SnsDestination.SnsDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SnsDestination.SnsDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SnsDestination.SnsDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SnsDestination.SnsDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SnsDestination.SnsDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SnsDestination.SnsDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.SnsDestination.SnsDestination


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestinationDefinition

-- | An object that defines the event destination. Specifically, it defines
--   which services receive events from emails sent using the configuration
--   set that the event destination is associated with. Also defines the
--   types of events that are sent to the event destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestinationDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestinationDefinition
EventDestinationDefinition' :: Maybe [EventType] -> Maybe PinpointDestination -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination -> EventDestinationDefinition

-- | An array that specifies which events Amazon Pinpoint should send to
--   the destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
[$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe [EventType]

-- | An object that defines a Amazon Pinpoint destination for email events.
--   You can use Amazon Pinpoint events to create attributes in Amazon
--   Pinpoint projects. You can use these attributes to create segments for
--   your campaigns.
[$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe PinpointDestination

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
[$sel:enabled:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
[$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
[$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
[$sel:snsDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'] :: EventDestinationDefinition -> Maybe SnsDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestinationDefinition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_matchingEventTypes</a> - An array that
--   specifies which events Amazon Pinpoint should send to the destinations
--   in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_pinpointDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines a Amazon Pinpoint destination for email events. You can use
--   Amazon Pinpoint events to create attributes in Amazon Pinpoint
--   projects. You can use these attributes to create segments for your
--   campaigns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_enabled</a> - If <tt>true</tt>, the
--   event destination is enabled. When the event destination is enabled,
--   the specified event types are sent to the destinations in this
--   <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - An
--   object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_cloudWatchDestination</a> - An object
--   that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on your email
--   sending metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_snsDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You can use Amazon
--   SNS to send notification when certain email events occur.
newEventDestinationDefinition :: EventDestinationDefinition

-- | An array that specifies which events Amazon Pinpoint should send to
--   the destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
eventDestinationDefinition_matchingEventTypes :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe [EventType])

-- | An object that defines a Amazon Pinpoint destination for email events.
--   You can use Amazon Pinpoint events to create attributes in Amazon
--   Pinpoint projects. You can use these attributes to create segments for
--   your campaigns.
eventDestinationDefinition_pinpointDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe PinpointDestination)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
eventDestinationDefinition_enabled :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
eventDestinationDefinition_kinesisFirehoseDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
eventDestinationDefinition_cloudWatchDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe CloudWatchDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
eventDestinationDefinition_snsDestination :: Lens' EventDestinationDefinition (Maybe SnsDestination)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestinationDefinition.EventDestinationDefinition


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestination

-- | In Amazon Pinpoint, <i>events</i> include message sends, deliveries,
--   opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. <i>Event destinations</i> are
--   places that you can send information about these events to. For
--   example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to receive
--   notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you can use
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term
--   storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestination</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestination
EventDestination' :: Maybe PinpointDestination -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination -> Text -> [EventType] -> EventDestination

-- | An object that defines a Amazon Pinpoint destination for email events.
--   You can use Amazon Pinpoint events to create attributes in Amazon
--   Pinpoint projects. You can use these attributes to create segments for
--   your campaigns.
[$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe PinpointDestination

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
[$sel:enabled:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
[$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
[$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
[$sel:snsDestination:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination

-- | A name that identifies the event destination.
[$sel:name:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> Text

-- | The types of events that Amazon Pinpoint sends to the specified event
--   destinations.
[$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'] :: EventDestination -> [EventType]

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_pinpointDestination</a> - An object that defines a
--   Amazon Pinpoint destination for email events. You can use Amazon
--   Pinpoint events to create attributes in Amazon Pinpoint projects. You
--   can use these attributes to create segments for your campaigns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_enabled</a>
--   - If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for email events.
--   You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to other
--   services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_cloudWatchDestination</a> - An object that defines
--   an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email events. You can use Amazon
--   CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on your email sending metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_snsDestination</a> - An object that defines an
--   Amazon SNS destination for email events. You can use Amazon SNS to
--   send notification when certain email events occur.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_name</a> - A
--   name that identifies the event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_matchingEventTypes</a> - The types of events that
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends to the specified event destinations.
newEventDestination :: Text -> EventDestination

-- | An object that defines a Amazon Pinpoint destination for email events.
--   You can use Amazon Pinpoint events to create attributes in Amazon
--   Pinpoint projects. You can use these attributes to create segments for
--   your campaigns.
eventDestination_pinpointDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe PinpointDestination)

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
eventDestination_enabled :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
eventDestination_cloudWatchDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe CloudWatchDestination)

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
eventDestination_snsDestination :: Lens' EventDestination (Maybe SnsDestination)

-- | A name that identifies the event destination.
eventDestination_name :: Lens' EventDestination Text

-- | The types of events that Amazon Pinpoint sends to the specified event
--   destinations.
eventDestination_matchingEventTypes :: Lens' EventDestination [EventType]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EventDestination.EventDestination


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Tag

-- | An object that defines the tags that are associated with a resource. A
--   <i>tag</i> is a label that you optionally define and associate with a
--   resource in Amazon Pinpoint. Tags can help you categorize and manage
--   resources in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment,
--   or other criteria. A resource can have as many as 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required <i>tag key</i> and an associated
--   <i>tag value</i>, both of which you define. A tag key is a general
--   label that acts as a category for a more specific tag value. A tag
--   value acts as a descriptor within a tag key. A tag key can contain as
--   many as 128 characters. A tag value can contain as many as 256
--   characters. The characters can be Unicode letters, digits, white
--   space, or one of the following symbols: _ . : / = + -. The following
--   additional restrictions apply to tags:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Tag keys and values are case sensitive.</li>
--   <li>For each associated resource, each tag key must be unique and it
--   can have only one value.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>aws:</tt> prefix is reserved for use by AWS; you can’t use
--   it in any tag keys or values that you define. In addition, you can't
--   edit or remove tag keys or values that use this prefix. Tags that use
--   this prefix don’t count against the limit of 50 tags per
--   resource.</li>
--   <li>You can associate tags with public or shared resources, but the
--   tags are available only for your AWS account, not any other accounts
--   that share the resource. In addition, the tags are available only for
--   resources that are located in the specified AWS Region for your AWS
--   account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | One part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of
--   a tag key is 128 characters. The minimum length is 1 character.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | The optional part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum
--   length of a tag value is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0
--   characters. If you don’t want a resource to have a specific tag value,
--   don’t specify a value for this parameter. Amazon Pinpoint will set the
--   value to an empty string.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - One part of a key-value pair
--   that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters.
--   The minimum length is 1 character.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The optional part of a
--   key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag value
--   is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0 characters. If you don’t
--   want a resource to have a specific tag value, don’t specify a value
--   for this parameter. Amazon Pinpoint will set the value to an empty
--   string.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | One part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of
--   a tag key is 128 characters. The minimum length is 1 character.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The optional part of a key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum
--   length of a tag value is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0
--   characters. If you don’t want a resource to have a specific tag value,
--   don’t specify a value for this parameter. Amazon Pinpoint will set the
--   value to an empty string.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Template

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data Template
Template' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Template

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
[$sel:templateArn:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
[$sel:templateData:Template'] :: Template -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Template</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateArn:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateData:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateData</a> - An
--   object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
newTemplate :: Template

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
template_templateArn :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
template_templateData :: Lens' Template (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Template.Template
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Template.Template
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Template.Template
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Template.Template
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.Template.Template


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EmailContent

-- | An object that defines the entire content of the email, including the
--   message headers and the body content. You can create a simple email
--   message, in which you specify the subject and the text and HTML
--   versions of the message body. You can also create raw messages, in
--   which you specify a complete MIME-formatted message. Raw messages can
--   include attachments and custom headers.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailContent</a> smart constructor.
data EmailContent
EmailContent' :: Maybe RawMessage -> Maybe Message -> Maybe Template -> EmailContent

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that
--   Amazon Pinpoint supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:raw:EmailContent'] :: EmailContent -> Maybe RawMessage

-- | The simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a
--   message body.
[$sel:simple:EmailContent'] :: EmailContent -> Maybe Message

-- | The template to use for the email message.
[$sel:template:EmailContent'] :: EmailContent -> Maybe Template

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:raw:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_raw</a> - The raw email
--   message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that
--   Amazon Pinpoint supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:simple:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_simple</a> - The
--   simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a message
--   body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:template:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_template</a> - The
--   template to use for the email message.
newEmailContent :: EmailContent

-- | The raw email message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that
--   Amazon Pinpoint supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
emailContent_raw :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe RawMessage)

-- | The simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a
--   message body.
emailContent_simple :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe Message)

-- | The template to use for the email message.
emailContent_template :: Lens' EmailContent (Maybe Template)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.EmailContent.EmailContent


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
newtype TlsPolicy
TlsPolicy' :: Text -> TlsPolicy
[fromTlsPolicy] :: TlsPolicy -> Text
pattern TlsPolicy_OPTIONAL :: TlsPolicy
pattern TlsPolicy_REQUIRE :: TlsPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TlsPolicy.TlsPolicy


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DeliveryOptions

-- | Used to associate a configuration set with a dedicated IP pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data DeliveryOptions
DeliveryOptions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TlsPolicy -> DeliveryOptions

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool that you want to associate with the
--   configuration set.
[$sel:sendingPoolName:DeliveryOptions'] :: DeliveryOptions -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
[$sel:tlsPolicy:DeliveryOptions'] :: DeliveryOptions -> Maybe TlsPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliveryOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingPoolName:DeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryOptions_sendingPoolName</a> - The name of the dedicated IP
--   pool that you want to associate with the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tlsPolicy:DeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryOptions_tlsPolicy</a> - Specifies whether messages that use
--   the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security
--   (TLS). If the value is <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered
--   if a TLS connection can be established. If the value is
--   <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be delivered in plain text if a TLS
--   connection can't be established.
newDeliveryOptions :: DeliveryOptions

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool that you want to associate with the
--   configuration set.
deliveryOptions_sendingPoolName :: Lens' DeliveryOptions (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
deliveryOptions_tlsPolicy :: Lens' DeliveryOptions (Maybe TlsPolicy)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DeliveryOptions.DeliveryOptions


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TrackingOptions

-- | An object that defines the tracking options for a configuration set.
--   When you use Amazon Pinpoint to send an email, it contains an
--   invisible image that's used to track when recipients open your email.
--   If your email contains links, those links are changed slightly in
--   order to track when recipients click them.
--   
--   These images and links include references to a domain operated by AWS.
--   You can optionally configure Amazon Pinpoint to use a domain that you
--   operate for these images and links.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTrackingOptions</a> smart constructor.
data TrackingOptions
TrackingOptions' :: Text -> TrackingOptions

-- | The domain that you want to use for tracking open and click events.
[$sel:customRedirectDomain:TrackingOptions'] :: TrackingOptions -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TrackingOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customRedirectDomain:TrackingOptions'</a>,
--   <a>trackingOptions_customRedirectDomain</a> - The domain that you want
--   to use for tracking open and click events.
newTrackingOptions :: Text -> TrackingOptions

-- | The domain that you want to use for tracking open and click events.
trackingOptions_customRedirectDomain :: Lens' TrackingOptions Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.TrackingOptions.TrackingOptions


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.VolumeStatistics

-- | An object that contains information about the amount of email that was
--   delivered to recipients.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeStatistics
VolumeStatistics' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> VolumeStatistics

-- | The total number of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
[$sel:inboxRawCount:VolumeStatistics'] :: VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | An estimate of the percentage of emails sent from the current domain
--   that will arrive in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
[$sel:projectedSpam:VolumeStatistics'] :: VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | An estimate of the percentage of emails sent from the current domain
--   that will arrive in recipients' inboxes.
[$sel:projectedInbox:VolumeStatistics'] :: VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | The total number of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk
--   mail folders.
[$sel:spamRawCount:VolumeStatistics'] :: VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxRawCount:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_inboxRawCount</a> - The total number of emails
--   that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedSpam:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_projectedSpam</a> - An estimate of the percentage
--   of emails sent from the current domain that will arrive in recipients'
--   spam or junk mail folders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedInbox:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_projectedInbox</a> - An estimate of the percentage
--   of emails sent from the current domain that will arrive in recipients'
--   inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamRawCount:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_spamRawCount</a> - The total number of emails that
--   arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
newVolumeStatistics :: VolumeStatistics

-- | The total number of emails that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
volumeStatistics_inboxRawCount :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | An estimate of the percentage of emails sent from the current domain
--   that will arrive in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
volumeStatistics_projectedSpam :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | An estimate of the percentage of emails sent from the current domain
--   that will arrive in recipients' inboxes.
volumeStatistics_projectedInbox :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)

-- | The total number of emails that arrived in recipients' spam or junk
--   mail folders.
volumeStatistics_spamRawCount :: Lens' VolumeStatistics (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.VolumeStatistics.VolumeStatistics


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.OverallVolume

-- | An object that contains information about email that was sent from the
--   selected domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOverallVolume</a> smart constructor.
data OverallVolume
OverallVolume' :: Maybe [DomainIspPlacement] -> Maybe VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Double -> OverallVolume

-- | An object that contains inbox and junk mail placement metrics for
--   individual email providers.
[$sel:domainIspPlacements:OverallVolume'] :: OverallVolume -> Maybe [DomainIspPlacement]

-- | An object that contains information about the numbers of messages that
--   arrived in recipients' inboxes and junk mail folders.
[$sel:volumeStatistics:OverallVolume'] :: OverallVolume -> Maybe VolumeStatistics

-- | The percentage of emails that were sent from the domain that were read
--   by their recipients.
[$sel:readRatePercent:OverallVolume'] :: OverallVolume -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>OverallVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainIspPlacements:OverallVolume'</a>,
--   <a>overallVolume_domainIspPlacements</a> - An object that contains
--   inbox and junk mail placement metrics for individual email providers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeStatistics:OverallVolume'</a>,
--   <a>overallVolume_volumeStatistics</a> - An object that contains
--   information about the numbers of messages that arrived in recipients'
--   inboxes and junk mail folders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readRatePercent:OverallVolume'</a>,
--   <a>overallVolume_readRatePercent</a> - The percentage of emails that
--   were sent from the domain that were read by their recipients.
newOverallVolume :: OverallVolume

-- | An object that contains inbox and junk mail placement metrics for
--   individual email providers.
overallVolume_domainIspPlacements :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe [DomainIspPlacement])

-- | An object that contains information about the numbers of messages that
--   arrived in recipients' inboxes and junk mail folders.
overallVolume_volumeStatistics :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe VolumeStatistics)

-- | The percentage of emails that were sent from the domain that were read
--   by their recipients.
overallVolume_readRatePercent :: Lens' OverallVolume (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.OverallVolume.OverallVolume
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.OverallVolume.OverallVolume
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.OverallVolume.OverallVolume
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.OverallVolume.OverallVolume
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.OverallVolume.OverallVolume
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.OverallVolume.OverallVolume
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.OverallVolume.OverallVolume


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DailyVolume

-- | An object that contains information about the volume of email sent on
--   each day of the analysis period.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDailyVolume</a> smart constructor.
data DailyVolume
DailyVolume' :: Maybe [DomainIspPlacement] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe VolumeStatistics -> DailyVolume

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specified day in
--   the analysis period, broken out by the recipient's email provider.
[$sel:domainIspPlacements:DailyVolume'] :: DailyVolume -> Maybe [DomainIspPlacement]

-- | The date that the DailyVolume metrics apply to, in Unix time.
[$sel:startDate:DailyVolume'] :: DailyVolume -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific day in
--   the analysis period.
[$sel:volumeStatistics:DailyVolume'] :: DailyVolume -> Maybe VolumeStatistics

-- | Create a value of <a>DailyVolume</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainIspPlacements:DailyVolume'</a>,
--   <a>dailyVolume_domainIspPlacements</a> - An object that contains inbox
--   placement metrics for a specified day in the analysis period, broken
--   out by the recipient's email provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:DailyVolume'</a>, <a>dailyVolume_startDate</a> - The
--   date that the DailyVolume metrics apply to, in Unix time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeStatistics:DailyVolume'</a>,
--   <a>dailyVolume_volumeStatistics</a> - An object that contains inbox
--   placement metrics for a specific day in the analysis period.
newDailyVolume :: DailyVolume

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specified day in
--   the analysis period, broken out by the recipient's email provider.
dailyVolume_domainIspPlacements :: Lens' DailyVolume (Maybe [DomainIspPlacement])

-- | The date that the DailyVolume metrics apply to, in Unix time.
dailyVolume_startDate :: Lens' DailyVolume (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that contains inbox placement metrics for a specific day in
--   the analysis period.
dailyVolume_volumeStatistics :: Lens' DailyVolume (Maybe VolumeStatistics)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DailyVolume.DailyVolume
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DailyVolume.DailyVolume
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DailyVolume.DailyVolume
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DailyVolume.DailyVolume
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DailyVolume.DailyVolume
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DailyVolume.DailyVolume
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DailyVolume.DailyVolume


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus

-- | The warmup status of a dedicated IP.
newtype WarmupStatus
WarmupStatus' :: Text -> WarmupStatus
[fromWarmupStatus] :: WarmupStatus -> Text
pattern WarmupStatus_DONE :: WarmupStatus
pattern WarmupStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: WarmupStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.WarmupStatus.WarmupStatus


module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.Types.DedicatedIp

-- | Contains information about a dedicated IP address that is associated
--   with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDedicatedIp</a> smart constructor.
data DedicatedIp
DedicatedIp' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> WarmupStatus -> Int -> DedicatedIp

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated
--   with.
[$sel:poolName:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> Maybe Text

-- | An IP address that is reserved for use by your Amazon Pinpoint
--   account.
[$sel:ip:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> Text

-- | The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have one
--   of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> – The IP address isn't ready to use because
--   the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.</li>
--   <li><tt>DONE</tt> – The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and
--   the IP address is ready to use.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:warmupStatus:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> WarmupStatus

-- | Indicates how complete the dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this
--   value equals 1, the address has completed the warm-up process and is
--   ready for use.
[$sel:warmupPercentage:DedicatedIp'] :: DedicatedIp -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DedicatedIp</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolName:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_poolName</a> - The
--   name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ip:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_ip</a> - An IP address
--   that is reserved for use by your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:warmupStatus:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_warmupStatus</a>
--   - The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> – The IP address isn't ready to use because
--   the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.</li>
--   <li><tt>DONE</tt> – The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and
--   the IP address is ready to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:warmupPercentage:DedicatedIp'</a>,
--   <a>dedicatedIp_warmupPercentage</a> - Indicates how complete the
--   dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this value equals 1, the address
--   has completed the warm-up process and is ready for use.
newDedicatedIp :: Text -> WarmupStatus -> Int -> DedicatedIp

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated
--   with.
dedicatedIp_poolName :: Lens' DedicatedIp (Maybe Text)

-- | An IP address that is reserved for use by your Amazon Pinpoint
--   account.
dedicatedIp_ip :: Lens' DedicatedIp Text

-- | The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have one
--   of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
