instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.SendEmail.SendEmailResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.SendEmail.SendEmailResponse

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.SendEmail.SendEmail
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.SendEmail.SendEmail
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.SendEmail.SendEmail
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.SendEmail.SendEmail
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.SendEmail.SendEmail
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.SendEmail.SendEmail


-- | Used to enable or disable the custom Mail-From domain configuration
--   for an email identity.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes

-- | A request to configure the custom MAIL FROM domain for a verified
--   identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BehaviorOnMxFailure -> Text -> PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes

-- | The custom MAIL FROM domain that you want the verified identity to
--   use. The MAIL FROM domain must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It has to be a subdomain of the verified identity.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used to receive email.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used in a "From" address if the MAIL FROM domain is a
--   destination for feedback forwarding emails.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:mailFromDomain:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The action that you want Amazon Pinpoint to take if it can't read the
--   required MX record when you send an email. When you set this value to
--   <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint uses <i>amazonses.com</i> as
--   the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to
--   <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't attempt to
--   deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
[$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes -> Maybe BehaviorOnMxFailure

-- | The verified email identity that you want to set up the custom MAIL
--   FROM domain for.
[$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomain:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain</a> - The custom
--   MAIL FROM domain that you want the verified identity to use. The MAIL
--   FROM domain must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It has to be a subdomain of the verified identity.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used to receive email.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used in a "From" address if the MAIL FROM domain is a
--   destination for feedback forwarding emails.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure</a> - The
--   action that you want Amazon Pinpoint to take if it can't read the
--   required MX record when you send an email. When you set this value to
--   <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint uses <i>amazonses.com</i> as
--   the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to
--   <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't attempt to
--   deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_emailIdentity</a> - The verified
--   email identity that you want to set up the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   for.
newPutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes :: Text -> PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes

-- | The custom MAIL FROM domain that you want the verified identity to
--   use. The MAIL FROM domain must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It has to be a subdomain of the verified identity.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used to receive email.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used in a "From" address if the MAIL FROM domain is a
--   destination for feedback forwarding emails.</li>
--   </ul>
putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The action that you want Amazon Pinpoint to take if it can't read the
--   required MX record when you send an email. When you set this value to
--   <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint uses <i>amazonses.com</i> as
--   the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to
--   <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't attempt to
--   deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes (Maybe BehaviorOnMxFailure)

-- | The verified email identity that you want to set up the custom MAIL
--   FROM domain for.
putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_emailIdentity :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes Text

-- | An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if
--   the request fails.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse
PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse' :: Int -> PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse'] :: PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newPutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse :: Int -> PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes.PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes


-- | Used to enable or disable feedback forwarding for an identity. This
--   setting determines what happens when an identity is used to send an
--   email that results in a bounce or complaint event.
--   
--   When you enable feedback forwarding, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email
--   notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint
--   sends this notification to the address that you specified in the
--   Return-Path header of the original email.
--   
--   When you disable feedback forwarding, Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon
--   SNS topic. You're required to have a method of tracking bounces and
--   complaints. If you haven't set up another mechanism for receiving
--   bounce or complaint notifications, Amazon Pinpoint sends an email
--   notification when these events occur (even if this setting is
--   disabled).
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes

-- | A request to set the attributes that control how bounce and complaint
--   events are processed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes
PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes

-- | Sets the feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email
--   notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint
--   sends this notification to the address that you specified in the
--   Return-Path header of the original email.
--   
--   When you set this value to <tt>false</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon
--   SNS topic or another event destination. You're required to have a
--   method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set up
--   another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends an email notification when these events occur
--   (even if this setting is disabled).
[$sel:emailForwardingEnabled:PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | The email identity that you want to configure bounce and complaint
--   feedback forwarding for.
[$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailForwardingEnabled:PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes_emailForwardingEnabled</a> -
--   Sets the feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email
--   notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint
--   sends this notification to the address that you specified in the
--   Return-Path header of the original email.
--   
--   When you set this value to <tt>false</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon
--   SNS topic or another event destination. You're required to have a
--   method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set up
--   another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends an email notification when these events occur
--   (even if this setting is disabled).
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes_emailIdentity</a> - The email
--   identity that you want to configure bounce and complaint feedback
--   forwarding for.
newPutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes :: Text -> PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes

-- | Sets the feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email
--   notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint
--   sends this notification to the address that you specified in the
--   Return-Path header of the original email.
--   
--   When you set this value to <tt>false</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon
--   SNS topic or another event destination. You're required to have a
--   method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set up
--   another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends an email notification when these events occur
--   (even if this setting is disabled).
putEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes_emailForwardingEnabled :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | The email identity that you want to configure bounce and complaint
--   feedback forwarding for.
putEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes_emailIdentity :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes Text

-- | An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if
--   the request fails.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse
PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse' :: Int -> PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse'] :: PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newPutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse :: Int -> PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
putEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributesResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes.PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes

-- | Used to enable or disable DKIM authentication for an email identity.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes

-- | A request to enable or disable DKIM signing of email that you send
--   from an email identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes
PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes

-- | Sets the DKIM signing configuration for the identity.
--   
--   When you set this value <tt>true</tt>, then the messages that Amazon
--   Pinpoint sends from the identity are DKIM-signed. When you set this
--   value to <tt>false</tt>, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.
[$sel:signingEnabled:PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | The email identity that you want to change the DKIM settings for.
[$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes'] :: PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingEnabled:PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityDkimAttributes_signingEnabled</a> - Sets the DKIM
--   signing configuration for the identity.
--   
--   When you set this value <tt>true</tt>, then the messages that Amazon
--   Pinpoint sends from the identity are DKIM-signed. When you set this
--   value to <tt>false</tt>, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityDkimAttributes_emailIdentity</a> - The email
--   identity that you want to change the DKIM settings for.
newPutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes :: Text -> PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes

-- | Sets the DKIM signing configuration for the identity.
--   
--   When you set this value <tt>true</tt>, then the messages that Amazon
--   Pinpoint sends from the identity are DKIM-signed. When you set this
--   value to <tt>false</tt>, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.
putEmailIdentityDkimAttributes_signingEnabled :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes (Maybe Bool)

-- | The email identity that you want to change the DKIM settings for.
putEmailIdentityDkimAttributes_emailIdentity :: Lens' PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes Text

-- | Enable or disable the Deliverability dashboard for your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account. When you enable the Deliverability dashboard, you
--   gain access to reputation, deliverability, and other metrics for the
--   domains that you use to send email using Amazon Pinpoint. You also
--   gain the ability to perform predictive inbox placement tests.
--   
--   When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly
--   subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by
--   using Amazon Pinpoint. For more information about the features and
--   cost of a Deliverability dashboard subscription, see <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint Pricing</a>.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption

-- | Enable or disable the Deliverability dashboard for your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account. When you enable the Deliverability dashboard, you
--   gain access to reputation, deliverability, and other metrics for the
--   domains that you use to send email using Amazon Pinpoint. You also
--   gain the ability to perform predictive inbox placement tests.
--   
--   When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly
--   subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by
--   using Amazon Pinpoint. For more information about the features and
--   cost of a Deliverability dashboard subscription, see <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint Pricing</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption
PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption' :: Maybe [DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption] -> Bool -> PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption

-- | An array of objects, one for each verified domain that you use to send
--   email and enabled the Deliverability dashboard for.
[$sel:subscribedDomains:PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption'] :: PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption -> Maybe [DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption]

-- | Specifies whether to enable the Deliverability dashboard for your
--   Amazon Pinpoint account. To enable the dashboard, set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt>.
[$sel:dashboardEnabled:PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption'] :: PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption -> Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:subscribedDomains:PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption'</a>,
--   <a>putDeliverabilityDashboardOption_subscribedDomains</a> - An array
--   of objects, one for each verified domain that you use to send email
--   and enabled the Deliverability dashboard for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dashboardEnabled:PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption'</a>,
--   <a>putDeliverabilityDashboardOption_dashboardEnabled</a> - Specifies
--   whether to enable the Deliverability dashboard for your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account. To enable the dashboard, set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt>.
newPutDeliverabilityDashboardOption :: Bool -> PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption

-- | An array of objects, one for each verified domain that you use to send
--   email and enabled the Deliverability dashboard for.
putDeliverabilityDashboardOption_subscribedDomains :: Lens' PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption (Maybe [DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption])

-- | Specifies whether to enable the Deliverability dashboard for your
--   Amazon Pinpoint account. To enable the dashboard, set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt>.
putDeliverabilityDashboardOption_dashboardEnabled :: Lens' PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption Bool

-- | A response that indicates whether the Deliverability dashboard is
--   enabled for your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutDeliverabilityDashboardOptionResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

--

-- | Move a dedicated IP address to an existing dedicated IP pool.
--   
--   The dedicated IP address that you specify must already exist, and must
--   be associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   The dedicated IP pool you specify must already exist. You can create a
--   new pool by using the <tt>CreateDedicatedIpPool</tt> operation.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutDedicatedIpInPool

-- | A request to move a dedicated IP address to a dedicated IP pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutDedicatedIpInPool</a> smart constructor.
data PutDedicatedIpInPool
PutDedicatedIpInPool' :: Text -> Text -> PutDedicatedIpInPool

-- | The IP address that you want to move to the dedicated IP pool. The
--   value you specify has to be a dedicated IP address that's associated
--   with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
[$sel:ip:PutDedicatedIpInPool'] :: PutDedicatedIpInPool -> Text

-- | The name of the IP pool that you want to add the dedicated IP address
--   to. You have to specify an IP pool that already exists.
[$sel:destinationPoolName:PutDedicatedIpInPool'] :: PutDedicatedIpInPool -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutDedicatedIpInPool</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:ip:PutDedicatedIpInPool'</a>, <a>putDedicatedIpInPool_ip</a> -
--   The IP address that you want to move to the dedicated IP pool. The
--   value you specify has to be a dedicated IP address that's associated
--   with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationPoolName:PutDedicatedIpInPool'</a>,
--   <a>putDedicatedIpInPool_destinationPoolName</a> - The name of the IP
--   pool that you want to add the dedicated IP address to. You have to
--   specify an IP pool that already exists.
newPutDedicatedIpInPool :: Text -> Text -> PutDedicatedIpInPool

-- | The IP address that you want to move to the dedicated IP pool. The
--   value you specify has to be a dedicated IP address that's associated
--   with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
putDedicatedIpInPool_ip :: Lens' PutDedicatedIpInPool Text

-- | The name of the IP pool that you want to add the dedicated IP address
--   to. You have to specify an IP pool that already exists.
putDedicatedIpInPool_destinationPoolName :: Lens' PutDedicatedIpInPool Text

--   the request fails.
--

-- | Specify a custom domain to use for open and click tracking elements in
--   email that you send using Amazon Pinpoint.

--

-- | Enable or disable email sending for messages that use a particular
--   configuration set in a specific AWS Region.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutConfigurationSetSendingOptions

-- | A request to enable or disable the ability of Amazon Pinpoint to send
--   emails that use a specific configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutConfigurationSetSendingOptions</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutConfigurationSetSendingOptions
PutConfigurationSetSendingOptions' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> PutConfigurationSetSendingOptions

-- | If <tt>true</tt>, email sending is enabled for the configuration set.
--   If <tt>false</tt>, email sending is disabled for the configuration
--   set.
[$sel:sendingEnabled:PutConfigurationSetSendingOptions'] :: PutConfigurationSetSendingOptions -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the configuration set that you want to enable or disable
--   email sending for.

--   <tt>true</tt>, email sending is enabled for the configuration set. If
--   <tt>false</tt>, email sending is disabled for the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:PutConfigurationSetSendingOptions'</a>,
--   <a>putConfigurationSetSendingOptions_configurationSetName</a> - The
--   name of the configuration set that you want to enable or disable email
--   sending for.

--   set.

--   email sending for.

-- | Associate a configuration set with a dedicated IP pool. You can use
--   dedicated IP pools to create groups of dedicated IP addresses for
--   sending specific types of email.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions

-- | A request to associate a configuration set with a dedicated IP pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions
PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TlsPolicy -> Text -> PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool that you want to associate with the
--   configuration set.
[$sel:sendingPoolName:PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions'] :: PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
[$sel:tlsPolicy:PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions'] :: PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions -> Maybe TlsPolicy

-- | The name of the configuration set that you want to associate with a
--   dedicated IP pool.
[$sel:configurationSetName:PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions'] :: PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingPoolName:PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>putConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions_sendingPoolName</a> - The name
--   of the dedicated IP pool that you want to associate with the
--   configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tlsPolicy:PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>putConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions_tlsPolicy</a> - Specifies
--   whether messages that use the configuration set are required to use
--   Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is <tt>Require</tt>,
--   messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can be established. If
--   the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be delivered in plain
--   text if a TLS connection can't be established.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>putConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions_configurationSetName</a> - The
--   name of the configuration set that you want to associate with a
--   dedicated IP pool.
newPutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions :: Text -> PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions

-- | The name of the dedicated IP pool that you want to associate with the
--   configuration set.
putConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions_sendingPoolName :: Lens' PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
putConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions_tlsPolicy :: Lens' PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions (Maybe TlsPolicy)

-- | The name of the configuration set that you want to associate with a
--   dedicated IP pool.
putConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions_configurationSetName :: Lens' PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions Text

--   the request fails.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptionsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   with all optional fields omitted.

--

-- | Enable or disable the ability of your account to send email.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutAccountSendingAttributes

-- | A request to change the ability of your account to send email.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutAccountSendingAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data PutAccountSendingAttributes
PutAccountSendingAttributes' :: Maybe Bool -> PutAccountSendingAttributes

-- | Enables or disables your account's ability to send email. Set to
--   <tt>true</tt> to enable email sending, or set to <tt>false</tt> to
--   disable email sending.
--   
--   If AWS paused your account's ability to send email, you can't use this
--   operation to resume your account's ability to send email.
[$sel:sendingEnabled:PutAccountSendingAttributes'] :: PutAccountSendingAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PutAccountSendingAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>putAccountSendingAttributes_sendingEnabled</a> - Enables or
--   disables your account's ability to send email. Set to <tt>true</tt> to
--   enable email sending, or set to <tt>false</tt> to disable email
--   sending.
--   
--   If AWS paused your account's ability to send email, you can't use this
--   operation to resume your account's ability to send email.
newPutAccountSendingAttributes :: PutAccountSendingAttributes

-- | Enables or disables your account's ability to send email. Set to
--   <tt>true</tt> to enable email sending, or set to <tt>false</tt> to
--   disable email sending.
--   
--   If AWS paused your account's ability to send email, you can't use this
--   operation to resume your account's ability to send email.
putAccountSendingAttributes_sendingEnabled :: Lens' PutAccountSendingAttributes (Maybe Bool)

--   the request fails.
--

-- | Enable or disable the automatic warm-up feature for dedicated IP
--   addresses.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes

-- | A request to enable or disable the automatic IP address warm-up
--   feature.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes
PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes' :: Maybe Bool -> PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes

-- | Enables or disables the automatic warm-up feature for dedicated IP
--   addresses that are associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account in the
--   current AWS Region. Set to <tt>true</tt> to enable the automatic
--   warm-up feature, or set to <tt>false</tt> to disable it.
[$sel:autoWarmupEnabled:PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes'] :: PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   Enables or disables the automatic warm-up feature for dedicated IP
--   addresses that are associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account in the
--   current AWS Region. Set to <tt>true</tt> to enable the automatic
--   warm-up feature, or set to <tt>false</tt> to disable it.
newPutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes :: PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributes

--   addresses that are associated with your Amazon Pinpoint account in the
--   current AWS Region. Set to <tt>true</tt> to enable the automatic
--   warm-up feature, or set to <tt>false</tt> to disable it.

-- | Retrieve a list of the tags (keys and values) that are associated with
--   a specified resource. A <i>tag</i> is a label that you optionally
--   define and associate with a resource in Amazon Pinpoint. Each tag
--   consists of a required <i>tag key</i> and an optional associated
--   <i>tag value</i>. A tag key is a general label that acts as a category
--   for more specific tag values. A tag value acts as a descriptor within
--   a tag key.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.ListTagsForResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTagsForResource</a> smart constructor.
data ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource' :: Text -> ListTagsForResource

--   retrieve tag information for.

--   omitted.

--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   (ARN) of the resource that you want to retrieve tag information for.

--   retrieve tag information for.

-- | Returns a list of all of the email identities that are associated with
--   your Amazon Pinpoint account. An identity can be either an email
--   address or a domain. This operation returns identities that are
--   verified as well as those that aren't.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.ListEmailIdentities

-- | A request to list all of the email identities associated with your
--   Amazon Pinpoint account. This list includes identities that you've
--   already verified, identities that are unverified, and identities that
--   were verified in the past, but are no longer verified.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListEmailIdentities</a> smart constructor.
data ListEmailIdentities
ListEmailIdentities' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> ListEmailIdentities

-- | A token returned from a previous call to <tt>ListEmailIdentities</tt>
--   to indicate the position in the list of identities.
[$sel:nextToken:ListEmailIdentities'] :: ListEmailIdentities -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of results to show in a single call to
--   <tt>ListEmailIdentities</tt>. If the number of results is larger than
--   the number you specified in this parameter, then the response includes
--   a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can use to obtain additional
--   results.
--   
--   The value you specify has to be at least 0, and can be no more than
--   1000.
[$sel:pageSize:ListEmailIdentities'] :: ListEmailIdentities -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListEmailIdentities</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListEmailIdentities'</a>,
--   <a>listEmailIdentities_nextToken</a> - A token returned from a
--   previous call to <tt>ListEmailIdentities</tt> to indicate the position
--   in the list of identities.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSize:ListEmailIdentities'</a>,
--   <a>listEmailIdentities_pageSize</a> - The number of results to show in
--   a single call to <tt>ListEmailIdentities</tt>. If the number of
--   results is larger than the number you specified in this parameter,
--   then the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can
--   use to obtain additional results.
--   
--   The value you specify has to be at least 0, and can be no more than
--   1000.
newListEmailIdentities :: ListEmailIdentities

-- | A token returned from a previous call to <tt>ListEmailIdentities</tt>
--   to indicate the position in the list of identities.
listEmailIdentities_nextToken :: Lens' ListEmailIdentities (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of results to show in a single call to
--   <tt>ListEmailIdentities</tt>. If the number of results is larger than
--   the number you specified in this parameter, then the response includes
--   a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can use to obtain additional
--   results.
--   
--   The value you specify has to be at least 0, and can be no more than
--   1000.
listEmailIdentities_pageSize :: Lens' ListEmailIdentities (Maybe Int)

-- | A list of all of the identities that you've attempted to verify for
--   use with Amazon Pinpoint, regardless of whether or not those
--   identities were successfully verified.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListEmailIdentitiesResponse</a> smart constructor.

-- | Retrieve deliverability data for all the campaigns that used a
--   specific domain to send email during a specified time range. This data
--   is available for a domain only if you enabled the Deliverability
--   dashboard (<tt>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</tt> operation) for
--   the domain.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns

-- | Retrieve deliverability data for all the campaigns that used a
--   specific domain to send email during a specified time range. This data
--   is available for a domain only if you enabled the Deliverability
--   dashboard (<tt>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</tt> operation) for
--   the domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns

-- | A token that’s returned from a previous call to the
--   <tt>ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns</tt> operation. This token
--   indicates the position of a campaign in the list of campaigns.

-- | The maximum number of results to include in response to a single call
--   to the <tt>ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns</tt> operation. If the
--   number of results is larger than the number that you specify in this
--   parameter, the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which
--   you can use to obtain additional results.
[$sel:pageSize:ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns'] :: ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns -> Maybe Int

-- | The first day, in Unix time format, that you want to obtain
--   deliverability data for.
[$sel:startDate:ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns'] :: ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns -> POSIX

-- | The last day, in Unix time format, that you want to obtain
--   deliverability data for. This value has to be less than or equal to 30
--   days after the value of the <tt>StartDate</tt> parameter.
[$sel:endDate:ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns'] :: ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns -> POSIX

-- | The domain to obtain deliverability data for.
[$sel:subscribedDomain:ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns'] :: ListDomainDeliverabilityCampaigns -> Text

--   optional fields omitted.

-- | Show a list of the predictive inbox placement tests that you've
--   performed, regardless of their statuses. For predictive inbox
--   placement tests that are complete, you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> operation to view the results.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.ListDeliverabilityTestReports

-- | A request to list all of the predictive inbox placement tests that
--   you've performed.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListDeliverabilityTestReports</a> smart constructor.

--   <tt>ListDeliverabilityTestReports</tt> to indicate the position in the

--   response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can use to
--   obtain additional results.
--

--   1000.

--   account in the current AWS Region.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--

-- | List all of the configuration sets associated with your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account in the current region.
--   
--   In Amazon Pinpoint, <i>configuration sets</i> are groups of rules that
--   you can apply to the emails you send. You apply a configuration set to
--   an email by including a reference to the configuration set in the
--   headers of the email. When you apply a configuration set to an email,
--   all of the rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.ListConfigurationSets

-- | A request to obtain a list of configuration sets for your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListConfigurationSets</a> smart constructor.
data ListConfigurationSets
ListConfigurationSets' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> ListConfigurationSets

-- | A token returned from a previous call to
--   <tt>ListConfigurationSets</tt> to indicate the position in the list of
--   configuration sets.
[$sel:nextToken:ListConfigurationSets'] :: ListConfigurationSets -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of results to show in a single call to
--   <tt>ListConfigurationSets</tt>. If the number of results is larger
--   than the number you specified in this parameter, then the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can use to obtain
--   additional results.
[$sel:pageSize:ListConfigurationSets'] :: ListConfigurationSets -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListConfigurationSets</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   position in the list of configuration sets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSize:ListConfigurationSets'</a>,
--   <a>listConfigurationSets_pageSize</a> - The number of results to show
--   in a single call to <tt>ListConfigurationSets</tt>. If the number of
--   results is larger than the number you specified in this parameter,
--   then the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can
--   use to obtain additional results.
newListConfigurationSets :: ListConfigurationSets

-- | A token returned from a previous call to
--   <tt>ListConfigurationSets</tt> to indicate the position in the list of
--   configuration sets.
listConfigurationSets_nextToken :: Lens' ListConfigurationSets (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of results to show in a single call to
--   <tt>ListConfigurationSets</tt>. If the number of results is larger
--   than the number you specified in this parameter, then the response
--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can use to obtain
--   additional results.
listConfigurationSets_pageSize :: Lens' ListConfigurationSets (Maybe Int)

--   <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter.
[$sel:nextToken:ListConfigurationSetsResponse'] :: ListConfigurationSetsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListConfigurationSetsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

-- | Provides information about a specific identity associated with your
--   Amazon Pinpoint account, including the identity's verification status,
--   its DKIM authentication status, and its custom Mail-From settings.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity

-- | A request to return details about an email identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetEmailIdentity</a> smart constructor.
data GetEmailIdentity
GetEmailIdentity' :: Text -> GetEmailIdentity

-- | The email identity that you want to retrieve details for.
[$sel:emailIdentity:GetEmailIdentity'] :: GetEmailIdentity -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetEmailIdentity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:GetEmailIdentity'</a>,
--   <a>getEmailIdentity_emailIdentity</a> - The email identity that you
--   want to retrieve details for.
newGetEmailIdentity :: Text -> GetEmailIdentity

-- | The email identity that you want to retrieve details for.
getEmailIdentity_emailIdentity :: Lens' GetEmailIdentity Text

-- | Details about an email identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetEmailIdentityResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetEmailIdentityResponse
GetEmailIdentityResponse' :: Maybe DkimAttributes -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe IdentityType -> Maybe MailFromAttributes -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Tag] -> Int -> GetEmailIdentityResponse

-- | An object that contains information about the DKIM attributes for the
--   identity. This object includes the tokens that you use to create the
--   CNAME records that are required to complete the DKIM verification
--   process.
[$sel:dkimAttributes:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe DkimAttributes

-- | Specifies whether or not the identity is verified. In Amazon Pinpoint,
--   you can only send email from verified email addresses or domains. For
--   more information about verifying identities, see the <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint User Guide</a>.
[$sel:verifiedForSendingStatus:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The email identity type.
[$sel:identityType:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe IdentityType

-- | An object that contains information about the Mail-From attributes for
--   the email identity.
[$sel:mailFromAttributes:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe MailFromAttributes

-- | The feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email
--   notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint
--   sends this notification to the address that you specified in the
--   Return-Path header of the original email.
--   
--   When you set this value to <tt>false</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon
--   SNS topic or another event destination. You're required to have a
--   method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set up
--   another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends an email notification when these events occur
--   (even if this setting is disabled).
[$sel:feedbackForwardingStatus:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that are
--   associated with the email identity.
[$sel:tags:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetEmailIdentityResponse'] :: GetEmailIdentityResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetEmailIdentityResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dkimAttributes:GetEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getEmailIdentityResponse_dkimAttributes</a> - An object that
--   contains information about the DKIM attributes for the identity. This
--   object includes the tokens that you use to create the CNAME records
--   that are required to complete the DKIM verification process.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verifiedForSendingStatus:GetEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getEmailIdentityResponse_verifiedForSendingStatus</a> - Specifies
--   whether or not the identity is verified. In Amazon Pinpoint, you can
--   only send email from verified email addresses or domains. For more
--   information about verifying identities, see the <a>Amazon Pinpoint
--   User Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityType:GetEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getEmailIdentityResponse_identityType</a> - The email identity
--   type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromAttributes:GetEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getEmailIdentityResponse_mailFromAttributes</a> - An object that
--   contains information about the Mail-From attributes for the email
--   identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingStatus:GetEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getEmailIdentityResponse_feedbackForwardingStatus</a> - The
--   feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email
--   notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint
--   sends this notification to the address that you specified in the
--   Return-Path header of the original email.
--   
--   When you set this value to <tt>false</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon
--   SNS topic or another event destination. You're required to have a
--   method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set up
--   another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends an email notification when these events occur
--   (even if this setting is disabled).
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:GetEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getEmailIdentityResponse_tags</a> - An array of objects that define
--   the tags (keys and values) that are associated with the email
--   identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getEmailIdentityResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetEmailIdentityResponse :: Int -> GetEmailIdentityResponse

-- | An object that contains information about the DKIM attributes for the
--   identity. This object includes the tokens that you use to create the
--   CNAME records that are required to complete the DKIM verification
--   process.
getEmailIdentityResponse_dkimAttributes :: Lens' GetEmailIdentityResponse (Maybe DkimAttributes)

-- | Specifies whether or not the identity is verified. In Amazon Pinpoint,
--   you can only send email from verified email addresses or domains. For
--   more information about verifying identities, see the <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint User Guide</a>.
getEmailIdentityResponse_verifiedForSendingStatus :: Lens' GetEmailIdentityResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The email identity type.
getEmailIdentityResponse_identityType :: Lens' GetEmailIdentityResponse (Maybe IdentityType)

-- | An object that contains information about the Mail-From attributes for
--   the email identity.
getEmailIdentityResponse_mailFromAttributes :: Lens' GetEmailIdentityResponse (Maybe MailFromAttributes)

-- | The feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email
--   notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint
--   sends this notification to the address that you specified in the
--   Return-Path header of the original email.
--   
--   When you set this value to <tt>false</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon
--   SNS topic or another event destination. You're required to have a
--   method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set up
--   another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends an email notification when these events occur
--   (even if this setting is disabled).
getEmailIdentityResponse_feedbackForwardingStatus :: Lens' GetEmailIdentityResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that are
--   associated with the email identity.
getEmailIdentityResponse_tags :: Lens' GetEmailIdentityResponse (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The response's http status code.
getEmailIdentityResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetEmailIdentityResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentity
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentityResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentityResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentityResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentityResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentityResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentity
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentity
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentity
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetEmailIdentity.GetEmailIdentity


-- | Retrieve inbox placement and engagement rates for the domains that you
--   use to send email.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetDomainStatisticsReport

-- | A request to obtain deliverability metrics for a domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDomainStatisticsReport</a> smart constructor.
data GetDomainStatisticsReport
GetDomainStatisticsReport' :: Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> GetDomainStatisticsReport

-- | The domain that you want to obtain deliverability metrics for.
[$sel:domain:GetDomainStatisticsReport'] :: GetDomainStatisticsReport -> Text

-- | The first day (in Unix time) that you want to obtain domain
--   deliverability metrics for.
[$sel:startDate:GetDomainStatisticsReport'] :: GetDomainStatisticsReport -> POSIX

-- | The last day (in Unix time) that you want to obtain domain
--   deliverability metrics for. The <tt>EndDate</tt> that you specify has
--   to be less than or equal to 30 days after the <tt>StartDate</tt>.
[$sel:endDate:GetDomainStatisticsReport'] :: GetDomainStatisticsReport -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDomainStatisticsReport</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:GetDomainStatisticsReport'</a>,
--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReport_domain</a> - The domain that you want to
--   obtain deliverability metrics for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:GetDomainStatisticsReport'</a>,
--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReport_startDate</a> - The first day (in Unix
--   time) that you want to obtain domain deliverability metrics for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDate:GetDomainStatisticsReport'</a>,
--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReport_endDate</a> - The last day (in Unix time)
--   that you want to obtain domain deliverability metrics for. The
--   <tt>EndDate</tt> that you specify has to be less than or equal to 30
--   days after the <tt>StartDate</tt>.
newGetDomainStatisticsReport :: Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> GetDomainStatisticsReport

-- | The domain that you want to obtain deliverability metrics for.
getDomainStatisticsReport_domain :: Lens' GetDomainStatisticsReport Text

-- | The first day (in Unix time) that you want to obtain domain
--   deliverability metrics for.
getDomainStatisticsReport_startDate :: Lens' GetDomainStatisticsReport UTCTime

-- | The last day (in Unix time) that you want to obtain domain
--   deliverability metrics for. The <tt>EndDate</tt> that you specify has
--   to be less than or equal to 30 days after the <tt>StartDate</tt>.
getDomainStatisticsReport_endDate :: Lens' GetDomainStatisticsReport UTCTime

-- | An object that includes statistics that are related to the domain that
--   you specified.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDomainStatisticsReportResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse
GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse' :: Int -> OverallVolume -> [DailyVolume] -> GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse'] :: GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse -> Int

-- | An object that contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you
--   specified. The data in this object is a summary of all of the data
--   that was collected from the <tt>StartDate</tt> to the
--   <tt>EndDate</tt>.
[$sel:overallVolume:GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse'] :: GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse -> OverallVolume

-- | An object that contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you
--   specified. This object contains data for each day, starting on the
--   <tt>StartDate</tt> and ending on the <tt>EndDate</tt>.
[$sel:dailyVolumes:GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse'] :: GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse -> [DailyVolume]

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReportResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:overallVolume:GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReportResponse_overallVolume</a> - An object
--   that contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you
--   specified. The data in this object is a summary of all of the data
--   that was collected from the <tt>StartDate</tt> to the
--   <tt>EndDate</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dailyVolumes:GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReportResponse_dailyVolumes</a> - An object that
--   contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you specified.
--   This object contains data for each day, starting on the
--   <tt>StartDate</tt> and ending on the <tt>EndDate</tt>.
newGetDomainStatisticsReportResponse :: Int -> OverallVolume -> GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
getDomainStatisticsReportResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse Int

-- | An object that contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you
--   specified. The data in this object is a summary of all of the data
--   that was collected from the <tt>StartDate</tt> to the
--   <tt>EndDate</tt>.
getDomainStatisticsReportResponse_overallVolume :: Lens' GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse OverallVolume

-- | An object that contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you
--   specified. This object contains data for each day, starting on the
--   <tt>StartDate</tt> and ending on the <tt>EndDate</tt>.
getDomainStatisticsReportResponse_dailyVolumes :: Lens' GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse [DailyVolume]

-- | Retrieve all the deliverability data for a specific campaign. This
--   data is available for a campaign only if the campaign sent email by
--   using a domain that the Deliverability dashboard is enabled for
--   (<tt>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</tt> operation).
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign

-- | Retrieve all the deliverability data for a specific campaign. This
--   data is available for a campaign only if the campaign sent email by
--   using a domain that the Deliverability dashboard is enabled for
--   (<tt>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</tt> operation).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign
GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign' :: Text -> GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign. Amazon Pinpoint automatically
--   generates and assigns this identifier to a campaign. This value is not
--   the same as the campaign identifier that Amazon Pinpoint assigns to
--   campaigns that you create and manage by using the Amazon Pinpoint API
--   or the Amazon Pinpoint console.
[$sel:campaignId:GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign'] :: GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   identifier for the campaign. Amazon Pinpoint automatically generates
--   and assigns this identifier to a campaign. This value is not the same
--   as the campaign identifier that Amazon Pinpoint assigns to campaigns
--   that you create and manage by using the Amazon Pinpoint API or the
--   Amazon Pinpoint console.
newGetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign :: Text -> GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign

-- | The unique identifier for the campaign. Amazon Pinpoint automatically
--   generates and assigns this identifier to a campaign. This value is not
--   the same as the campaign identifier that Amazon Pinpoint assigns to
--   campaigns that you create and manage by using the Amazon Pinpoint API
--   or the Amazon Pinpoint console.
getDomainDeliverabilityCampaign_campaignId :: Lens' GetDomainDeliverabilityCampaign Text

-- | An object that contains all the deliverability data for a specific
--   campaign. This data is available for a campaign only if the campaign
--   sent email by using a domain that the Deliverability dashboard is
--   enabled for (<tt>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</tt> operation).

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDomainDeliverabilityCampaignResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Retrieve the results of a predictive inbox placement test.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetDeliverabilityTestReport

-- | A request to retrieve the results of a predictive inbox placement
--   test.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDeliverabilityTestReport</a> smart constructor.
data GetDeliverabilityTestReport
GetDeliverabilityTestReport' :: Text -> GetDeliverabilityTestReport

-- | A unique string that identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:reportId:GetDeliverabilityTestReport'] :: GetDeliverabilityTestReport -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportId:GetDeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>getDeliverabilityTestReport_reportId</a> - A unique string that
--   identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
newGetDeliverabilityTestReport :: Text -> GetDeliverabilityTestReport

-- | A unique string that identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
getDeliverabilityTestReport_reportId :: Lens' GetDeliverabilityTestReport Text

-- | The results of the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse
GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Int -> DeliverabilityTestReport -> PlacementStatistics -> [IspPlacement] -> GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse

-- | An object that contains the message that you sent when you performed
--   this predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:message:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'] :: GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that are
--   associated with the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:tags:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'] :: GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'] :: GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse -> Int

-- | An object that contains the results of the predictive inbox placement
--   test.
[$sel:deliverabilityTestReport:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'] :: GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse -> DeliverabilityTestReport

-- | An object that specifies how many test messages that were sent during
--   the predictive inbox placement test were delivered to recipients'
--   inboxes, how many were sent to recipients' spam folders, and how many
--   weren't delivered.
[$sel:overallPlacement:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'] :: GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse -> PlacementStatistics

-- | An object that describes how the test email was handled by several
--   email providers, including Gmail, Hotmail, Yahoo, AOL, and others.
[$sel:ispPlacements:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'] :: GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse -> [IspPlacement]

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_message</a> - An object that
--   contains the message that you sent when you performed this predictive
--   inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_tags</a> - An array of objects
--   that define the tags (keys and values) that are associated with the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliverabilityTestReport:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_deliverabilityTestReport</a> -
--   An object that contains the results of the predictive inbox placement
--   test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:overallPlacement:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_overallPlacement</a> - An
--   object that specifies how many test messages that were sent during the
--   predictive inbox placement test were delivered to recipients' inboxes,
--   how many were sent to recipients' spam folders, and how many weren't
--   delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ispPlacements:GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_ispPlacements</a> - An object
--   that describes how the test email was handled by several email
--   providers, including Gmail, Hotmail, Yahoo, AOL, and others.
newGetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse :: Int -> DeliverabilityTestReport -> PlacementStatistics -> GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse

--   this predictive inbox placement test.

--   associated with the predictive inbox placement test.

getDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_overallPlacement :: Lens' GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse PlacementStatistics

-- | Retrieve information about the status of the Deliverability dashboard
--   for your Amazon Pinpoint account. When the Deliverability dashboard is
--   enabled, you gain access to reputation, deliverability, and other
--   metrics for the domains that you use to send email using Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You also gain the ability to perform predictive inbox
--   placement tests.
--   
--   When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly
--   subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by
--   using Amazon Pinpoint. For more information about the features and
--   cost of a Deliverability dashboard subscription, see <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint Pricing</a>.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptions

-- | Retrieve information about the status of the Deliverability dashboard
--   for your Amazon Pinpoint account. When the Deliverability dashboard is
--   enabled, you gain access to reputation, deliverability, and other
--   metrics for the domains that you use to send email using Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You also gain the ability to perform predictive inbox
--   placement tests.
--   
--   When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly
--   subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by
--   using Amazon Pinpoint. For more information about the features and
--   cost of a Deliverability dashboard subscription, see <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint Pricing</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDeliverabilityDashboardOptions</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptions
GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptions' :: GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptions

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptions</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newGetDeliverabilityDashboardOptions :: GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptions

-- | An object that shows the status of the Deliverability dashboard for
--   your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse
GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse' :: Maybe DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption] -> Maybe [DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption] -> Int -> Bool -> GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse

-- | The current status of your Deliverability dashboard subscription. If
--   this value is <tt>PENDING_EXPIRATION</tt>, your subscription is
--   scheduled to expire at the end of the current calendar month.
[$sel:accountStatus:GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse'] :: GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse -> Maybe DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus

-- | The date, in Unix time format, when your current subscription to the
--   Deliverability dashboard is scheduled to expire, if your subscription
--   is scheduled to expire at the end of the current calendar month. This
--   value is null if you have an active subscription that isn’t due to
--   expire at the end of the month.
[$sel:subscriptionExpiryDate:GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse'] :: GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An array of objects, one for each verified domain that you use to send
--   email and currently has an active Deliverability dashboard
--   subscription that isn’t scheduled to expire at the end of the current
--   calendar month.
[$sel:activeSubscribedDomains:GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse'] :: GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse -> Maybe [DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption]

--   email and currently has an active Deliverability dashboard
--   subscription that's scheduled to expire at the end of the current
--   calendar month.

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse'] :: GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse -> Int

--   Amazon Pinpoint account. If this value is <tt>true</tt>, the dashboard
--   is enabled.
[$sel:dashboardEnabled:GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse'] :: GetDeliverabilityDashboardOptionsResponse -> Bool

--   Pinpoint account.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDedicatedIps</a> smart constructor.

--   with.

--   indicate the position of the dedicated IP pool in the list of IP
--   pools.

--   includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can use to obtain
--   additional results.

-- | Retrieve a list of event destinations that are associated with a
--   configuration set.
--   
--   In Amazon Pinpoint, <i>events</i> include message sends, deliveries,
--   opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. <i>Event destinations</i> are
--   places that you can send information about these events to. For
--   example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to receive
--   notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you can use
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term
--   storage.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetConfigurationSetEventDestinations

-- | A request to obtain information about the event destinations for a
--   configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetConfigurationSetEventDestinations</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetConfigurationSetEventDestinations

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:GetConfigurationSetEventDestinations'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSetEventDestinations_configurationSetName</a> - The
--   name of the configuration set that contains the event destination.
newGetConfigurationSetEventDestinations :: Text -> GetConfigurationSetEventDestinations

--   configured for the configuration set.

-- | Get information about an existing configuration set, including the
--   dedicated IP pool that it's associated with, whether or not it's
--   enabled for sending email, and more.
--   
--   In Amazon Pinpoint, <i>configuration sets</i> are groups of rules that
--   you can apply to the emails you send. You apply a configuration set to
--   an email by including a reference to the configuration set in the
--   headers of the email. When you apply a configuration set to an email,
--   all of the rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetConfigurationSet

-- | A request to obtain information about a configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetConfigurationSet</a> smart constructor.
data GetConfigurationSet
GetConfigurationSet' :: Text -> GetConfigurationSet

-- | The name of the configuration set that you want to obtain more
--   information about.
[$sel:configurationSetName:GetConfigurationSet'] :: GetConfigurationSet -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetConfigurationSet</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:GetConfigurationSet'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSet_configurationSetName</a> - The name of the
--   configuration set that you want to obtain more information about.
newGetConfigurationSet :: Text -> GetConfigurationSet

-- | The name of the configuration set that you want to obtain more
--   information about.
getConfigurationSet_configurationSetName :: Lens' GetConfigurationSet Text

-- | Information about a configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetConfigurationSetResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetConfigurationSetResponse
GetConfigurationSetResponse' :: Maybe SendingOptions -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DeliveryOptions -> Maybe TrackingOptions -> Maybe ReputationOptions -> Maybe [Tag] -> Int -> GetConfigurationSetResponse

-- | An object that defines whether or not Amazon Pinpoint can send email
--   that you send using the configuration set.
[$sel:sendingOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'] :: GetConfigurationSetResponse -> Maybe SendingOptions

-- | The name of the configuration set.
[$sel:configurationSetName:GetConfigurationSetResponse'] :: GetConfigurationSetResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that defines the dedicated IP pool that is used to send
--   emails that you send using the configuration set.
[$sel:deliveryOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'] :: GetConfigurationSetResponse -> Maybe DeliveryOptions

-- | An object that defines the open and click tracking options for emails
--   that you send using the configuration set.
[$sel:trackingOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'] :: GetConfigurationSetResponse -> Maybe TrackingOptions

-- | An object that defines whether or not Amazon Pinpoint collects
--   reputation metrics for the emails that you send that use the
--   configuration set.
[$sel:reputationOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'] :: GetConfigurationSetResponse -> Maybe ReputationOptions

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that are
--   associated with the configuration set.
[$sel:tags:GetConfigurationSetResponse'] :: GetConfigurationSetResponse -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetConfigurationSetResponse'] :: GetConfigurationSetResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetConfigurationSetResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSetResponse_sendingOptions</a> - An object that
--   defines whether or not Amazon Pinpoint can send email that you send
--   using the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:GetConfigurationSet'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSetResponse_configurationSetName</a> - The name of
--   the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'</a>,

--   defines the dedicated IP pool that is used to send emails that you
--   send using the configuration set.
--

--   <a>getConfigurationSetResponse_trackingOptions</a> - An object that
--   defines the open and click tracking options for emails that you send
--   using the configuration set.

--   <a>$sel:reputationOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'</a>,

--   defines whether or not Amazon Pinpoint collects reputation metrics for
--   the emails that you send that use the configuration set.

--   configuration set.

--   reputation metrics for the emails that you send that use the
