-- | Retrieve a list of the blacklists that your dedicated IP addresses
--   appear on.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetBlacklistReports

-- | A request to retrieve a list of the blacklists that your dedicated IP
--   addresses appear on.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBlacklistReports</a> smart constructor.
data GetBlacklistReports
GetBlacklistReports' :: [Text] -> GetBlacklistReports

-- | A list of IP addresses that you want to retrieve blacklist information
--   about. You can only specify the dedicated IP addresses that you use to
--   send email using Amazon Pinpoint or Amazon SES.
[$sel:blacklistItemNames:GetBlacklistReports'] :: GetBlacklistReports -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBlacklistReports</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   that you want to retrieve blacklist information about. You can only
--   specify the dedicated IP addresses that you use to send email using
--   Amazon Pinpoint or Amazon SES.
newGetBlacklistReports :: GetBlacklistReports

-- | A list of IP addresses that you want to retrieve blacklist information
--   about. You can only specify the dedicated IP addresses that you use to
--   send email using Amazon Pinpoint or Amazon SES.
getBlacklistReports_blacklistItemNames :: Lens' GetBlacklistReports [Text]

-- | An object that contains information about blacklist events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBlacklistReportsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetBlacklistReportsResponse
GetBlacklistReportsResponse' :: Int -> HashMap Text [BlacklistEntry] -> GetBlacklistReportsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetBlacklistReportsResponse'] :: GetBlacklistReportsResponse -> Int

-- | An object that contains information about a blacklist that one of your
--   dedicated IP addresses appears on.
[$sel:blacklistReport:GetBlacklistReportsResponse'] :: GetBlacklistReportsResponse -> HashMap Text [BlacklistEntry]

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBlacklistReportsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blacklistReport:GetBlacklistReportsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBlacklistReportsResponse_blacklistReport</a> - An object that
--   contains information about a blacklist that one of your dedicated IP
--   addresses appears on.

--   dedicated IP addresses appears on.

-- | Obtain information about the email-sending status and capabilities of
--   your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount

-- | A request to obtain information about the email-sending capabilities
--   of your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetAccount</a> smart constructor.
data GetAccount
GetAccount' :: GetAccount

-- | Create a value of <a>GetAccount</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newGetAccount :: GetAccount

-- | A list of details about the email-sending capabilities of your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetAccountResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetAccountResponse
GetAccountResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe SendQuota -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Int -> GetAccountResponse

-- | The reputation status of your Amazon Pinpoint account. The status can
--   be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>HEALTHY</tt> – There are no reputation-related issues that
--   currently impact your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>PROBATION</tt> – We've identified some issues with your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account. We're placing your account under review while you
--   work on correcting these issues.</li>
--   <li><tt>SHUTDOWN</tt> – Your account's ability to send email is
--   currently paused because of an issue with the email sent from your
--   account. When you correct the issue, you can contact us and request
--   that your account's ability to send email is resumed.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:enforcementStatus:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether or not the automatic warm-up feature is enabled for
--   dedicated IP addresses that are associated with your account.
[$sel:dedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | An object that contains information about the per-day and per-second
--   sending limits for your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS
--   Region.
[$sel:sendQuota:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe SendQuota

-- | Indicates whether or not your account has production access in the
--   current AWS Region.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then your account is in the
--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.
[$sel:productionAccessEnabled:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | Indicates whether or not email sending is enabled for your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.
[$sel:sendingEnabled:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetAccountResponse'] :: GetAccountResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetAccountResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enforcementStatus:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_enforcementStatus</a> - The reputation status of
--   your Amazon Pinpoint account. The status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>HEALTHY</tt> – There are no reputation-related issues that
--   currently impact your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>PROBATION</tt> – We've identified some issues with your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account. We're placing your account under review while you
--   work on correcting these issues.</li>
--   <li><tt>SHUTDOWN</tt> – Your account's ability to send email is
--   currently paused because of an issue with the email sent from your
--   account. When you correct the issue, you can contact us and request
--   that your account's ability to send email is resumed.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_dedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled</a> - Indicates
--   whether or not the automatic warm-up feature is enabled for dedicated
--   IP addresses that are associated with your account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendQuota:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_sendQuota</a> - An object that contains
--   information about the per-day and per-second sending limits for your
--   Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productionAccessEnabled:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_productionAccessEnabled</a> - Indicates whether
--   or not your account has production access in the current AWS Region.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then your account is in the
--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingEnabled:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_sendingEnabled</a> - Indicates whether or not
--   email sending is enabled for your Amazon Pinpoint account in the
--   current AWS Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetAccountResponse :: Int -> GetAccountResponse

-- | The reputation status of your Amazon Pinpoint account. The status can
--   be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>HEALTHY</tt> – There are no reputation-related issues that
--   currently impact your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>PROBATION</tt> – We've identified some issues with your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account. We're placing your account under review while you
--   work on correcting these issues.</li>
--   <li><tt>SHUTDOWN</tt> – Your account's ability to send email is
--   currently paused because of an issue with the email sent from your
--   account. When you correct the issue, you can contact us and request
--   that your account's ability to send email is resumed.</li>
--   </ul>
getAccountResponse_enforcementStatus :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether or not the automatic warm-up feature is enabled for
--   dedicated IP addresses that are associated with your account.
getAccountResponse_dedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | An object that contains information about the per-day and per-second
--   sending limits for your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS
--   Region.
getAccountResponse_sendQuota :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe SendQuota)

-- | Indicates whether or not your account has production access in the
--   current AWS Region.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then your account is in the
--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.
getAccountResponse_productionAccessEnabled :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | Indicates whether or not email sending is enabled for your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.
getAccountResponse_sendingEnabled :: Lens' GetAccountResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The response's http status code.
getAccountResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetAccountResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccountResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccountResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccountResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccountResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccountResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccount
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.GetAccount.GetAccount


-- | Deletes an email identity that you previously verified for use with
--   Amazon Pinpoint. An identity can be either an email address or a
--   domain name.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteEmailIdentity

-- | A request to delete an existing email identity. When you delete an
--   identity, you lose the ability to use Amazon Pinpoint to send email
--   from that identity. You can restore your ability to send email by
--   completing the verification process for the identity again.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteEmailIdentity</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteEmailIdentity
DeleteEmailIdentity' :: Text -> DeleteEmailIdentity

-- | The identity (that is, the email address or domain) that you want to
--   delete from your Amazon Pinpoint account.
[$sel:emailIdentity:DeleteEmailIdentity'] :: DeleteEmailIdentity -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteEmailIdentity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:DeleteEmailIdentity'</a>,
--   <a>deleteEmailIdentity_emailIdentity</a> - The identity (that is, the
--   email address or domain) that you want to delete from your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account.
newDeleteEmailIdentity :: Text -> DeleteEmailIdentity

-- | The identity (that is, the email address or domain) that you want to
--   delete from your Amazon Pinpoint account.
deleteEmailIdentity_emailIdentity :: Lens' DeleteEmailIdentity Text

-- | An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if
--   the request fails.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteEmailIdentityResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteEmailIdentityResponse
DeleteEmailIdentityResponse' :: Int -> DeleteEmailIdentityResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteEmailIdentityResponse'] :: DeleteEmailIdentityResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteEmailIdentityResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteEmailIdentityResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDeleteEmailIdentityResponse :: Int -> DeleteEmailIdentityResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteEmailIdentityResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteEmailIdentityResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteDedicatedIpPool.DeleteDedicatedIpPoolResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteDedicatedIpPool.DeleteDedicatedIpPoolResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteDedicatedIpPool.DeleteDedicatedIpPoolResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteDedicatedIpPool.DeleteDedicatedIpPoolResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteDedicatedIpPool.DeleteDedicatedIpPool
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteDedicatedIpPool.DeleteDedicatedIpPool
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteDedicatedIpPool.DeleteDedicatedIpPool
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteDedicatedIpPool.DeleteDedicatedIpPool
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteDedicatedIpPool.DeleteDedicatedIpPool


-- | Delete an event destination.
--   
--   In Amazon Pinpoint, <i>events</i> include message sends, deliveries,
--   opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. <i>Event destinations</i> are
--   places that you can send information about these events to. For
--   example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to receive
--   notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you can use
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term
--   storage.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteConfigurationSetEventDestination

-- | A request to delete an event destination from a configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteConfigurationSetEventDestination</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DeleteConfigurationSetEventDestination

--   that you want to delete.

--   fields.

--   that you want to delete.

--   <a>deleteConfigurationSetEventDestination_eventDestinationName</a> -
--   The name of the event destination that you want to delete.

--   that you want to delete.

-- | Delete an existing configuration set.
--   
--   In Amazon Pinpoint, <i>configuration sets</i> are groups of rules that
--   you can apply to the emails you send. You apply a configuration set to
--   an email by including a reference to the configuration set in the
--   headers of the email. When you apply a configuration set to an email,
--   all of the rules in that configuration set are applied to the email.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.DeleteConfigurationSet

-- | A request to delete a configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteConfigurationSet</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteConfigurationSet

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:DeleteConfigurationSet'</a>,
--   <a>deleteConfigurationSet_configurationSetName</a> - The name of the
--   configuration set that you want to delete.

-- | The name of the configuration set that you want to delete.
deleteConfigurationSet_configurationSetName :: Lens' DeleteConfigurationSet Text

--   the request fails.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteConfigurationSetResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Verifies an email identity for use with Amazon Pinpoint. In Amazon
--   Pinpoint, an identity is an email address or domain that you use when
--   you send email. Before you can use an identity to send email with
--   Amazon Pinpoint, you first have to verify it. By verifying an address,
--   you demonstrate that you're the owner of the address, and that you've
--   given Amazon Pinpoint permission to send email from the address.
--   
--   When you verify an email address, Amazon Pinpoint sends an email to
--   the address. Your email address is verified as soon as you follow the
--   link in the verification email.
--   
--   When you verify a domain, this operation provides a set of DKIM
--   tokens, which you can convert into CNAME tokens. You add these CNAME
--   tokens to the DNS configuration for your domain. Your domain is
--   verified when Amazon Pinpoint detects these records in the DNS
--   configuration for your domain. It usually takes around 72 hours to
--   complete the domain verification process.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity

-- | A request to begin the verification process for an email identity (an
--   email address or domain).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateEmailIdentity</a> smart constructor.
data CreateEmailIdentity
CreateEmailIdentity' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> CreateEmailIdentity

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that you
--   want to associate with the email identity.
[$sel:tags:CreateEmailIdentity'] :: CreateEmailIdentity -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The email address or domain that you want to verify.
[$sel:emailIdentity:CreateEmailIdentity'] :: CreateEmailIdentity -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateEmailIdentity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateEmailIdentity'</a>, <a>createEmailIdentity_tags</a>
--   - An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that you
--   want to associate with the email identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:CreateEmailIdentity'</a>,
--   <a>createEmailIdentity_emailIdentity</a> - The email address or domain
--   that you want to verify.
newCreateEmailIdentity :: Text -> CreateEmailIdentity

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that you
--   want to associate with the email identity.
createEmailIdentity_tags :: Lens' CreateEmailIdentity (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The email address or domain that you want to verify.
createEmailIdentity_emailIdentity :: Lens' CreateEmailIdentity Text

-- | If the email identity is a domain, this object contains tokens that
--   you can use to create a set of CNAME records. To sucessfully verify
--   your domain, you have to add these records to the DNS configuration
--   for your domain.
--   
--   If the email identity is an email address, this object is empty.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateEmailIdentityResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateEmailIdentityResponse
CreateEmailIdentityResponse' :: Maybe DkimAttributes -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe IdentityType -> Int -> CreateEmailIdentityResponse

-- | An object that contains information about the DKIM attributes for the
--   identity. This object includes the tokens that you use to create the
--   CNAME records that are required to complete the DKIM verification
--   process.
[$sel:dkimAttributes:CreateEmailIdentityResponse'] :: CreateEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe DkimAttributes

-- | Specifies whether or not the identity is verified. In Amazon Pinpoint,
--   you can only send email from verified email addresses or domains. For
--   more information about verifying identities, see the <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint User Guide</a>.
[$sel:verifiedForSendingStatus:CreateEmailIdentityResponse'] :: CreateEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The email identity type.
[$sel:identityType:CreateEmailIdentityResponse'] :: CreateEmailIdentityResponse -> Maybe IdentityType

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateEmailIdentityResponse'] :: CreateEmailIdentityResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateEmailIdentityResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dkimAttributes:CreateEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createEmailIdentityResponse_dkimAttributes</a> - An object that
--   contains information about the DKIM attributes for the identity. This
--   object includes the tokens that you use to create the CNAME records
--   that are required to complete the DKIM verification process.
--   
--   <a>$sel:verifiedForSendingStatus:CreateEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createEmailIdentityResponse_verifiedForSendingStatus</a> -
--   Specifies whether or not the identity is verified. In Amazon Pinpoint,
--   you can only send email from verified email addresses or domains. For
--   more information about verifying identities, see the <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint User Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityType:CreateEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createEmailIdentityResponse_identityType</a> - The email identity
--   type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateEmailIdentityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createEmailIdentityResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newCreateEmailIdentityResponse :: Int -> CreateEmailIdentityResponse

-- | An object that contains information about the DKIM attributes for the
--   identity. This object includes the tokens that you use to create the
--   CNAME records that are required to complete the DKIM verification
--   process.
createEmailIdentityResponse_dkimAttributes :: Lens' CreateEmailIdentityResponse (Maybe DkimAttributes)

-- | Specifies whether or not the identity is verified. In Amazon Pinpoint,
--   you can only send email from verified email addresses or domains. For
--   more information about verifying identities, see the <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint User Guide</a>.
createEmailIdentityResponse_verifiedForSendingStatus :: Lens' CreateEmailIdentityResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The email identity type.
createEmailIdentityResponse_identityType :: Lens' CreateEmailIdentityResponse (Maybe IdentityType)

-- | The response's http status code.
createEmailIdentityResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateEmailIdentityResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentity
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentity
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentity
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentity
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentityResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentityResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentityResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentityResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentityResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentity
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentity
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentity
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentity
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentity
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateEmailIdentity.CreateEmailIdentity


-- | Create a new predictive inbox placement test. Predictive inbox
--   placement tests can help you predict how your messages will be handled
--   by various email providers around the world. When you perform a
--   predictive inbox placement test, you provide a sample message that
--   contains the content that you plan to send to your customers. Amazon
--   Pinpoint then sends that message to special email addresses spread
--   across several major email providers. After about 24 hours, the test
--   is complete, and you can use the <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt>
--   operation to view the results of the test.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateDeliverabilityTestReport

-- | A request to perform a predictive inbox placement test. Predictive
--   inbox placement tests can help you predict how your messages will be
--   handled by various email providers around the world. When you perform
--   a predictive inbox placement test, you provide a sample message that
--   contains the content that you plan to send to your customers. Amazon
--   Pinpoint then sends that message to special email addresses spread
--   across several major email providers. After about 24 hours, the test
--   is complete, and you can use the <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt>
--   operation to view the results of the test.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDeliverabilityTestReport</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateDeliverabilityTestReport
CreateDeliverabilityTestReport' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> EmailContent -> CreateDeliverabilityTestReport

-- | A unique name that helps you to identify the predictive inbox
--   placement test when you retrieve the results.
[$sel:reportName:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'] :: CreateDeliverabilityTestReport -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that you
--   want to associate with the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:tags:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'] :: CreateDeliverabilityTestReport -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The email address that the predictive inbox placement test email was
--   sent from.
[$sel:fromEmailAddress:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'] :: CreateDeliverabilityTestReport -> Text

-- | The HTML body of the message that you sent when you performed the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:content:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'] :: CreateDeliverabilityTestReport -> EmailContent

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateDeliverabilityTestReport</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportName:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReport_reportName</a> - A unique name that
--   helps you to identify the predictive inbox placement test when you
--   retrieve the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReport_tags</a> - An array of objects that
--   define the tags (keys and values) that you want to associate with the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReport_fromEmailAddress</a> - The email
--   address that the predictive inbox placement test email was sent from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReport_content</a> - The HTML body of the
--   message that you sent when you performed the predictive inbox
--   placement test.
newCreateDeliverabilityTestReport :: Text -> EmailContent -> CreateDeliverabilityTestReport

-- | A unique name that helps you to identify the predictive inbox
--   placement test when you retrieve the results.
createDeliverabilityTestReport_reportName :: Lens' CreateDeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe Text)

--   want to associate with the predictive inbox placement test.
createDeliverabilityTestReport_tags :: Lens' CreateDeliverabilityTestReport (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The email address that the predictive inbox placement test email was
--   sent from.
createDeliverabilityTestReport_fromEmailAddress :: Lens' CreateDeliverabilityTestReport Text

-- | The HTML body of the message that you sent when you performed the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
createDeliverabilityTestReport_content :: Lens' CreateDeliverabilityTestReport EmailContent

-- | Information about the predictive inbox placement test that you
--   created.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse
CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse' :: Int -> Text -> DeliverabilityTestStatus -> CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'] :: CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse -> Int

-- | A unique string that identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
[$sel:reportId:CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'] :: CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse -> Text

-- | The status of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> to view the results of the test.
[$sel:deliverabilityTestStatus:CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'] :: CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse -> DeliverabilityTestStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_reportId</a> - A unique
--   string that identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliverabilityTestStatus:CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_deliverabilityTestStatus</a>
--   - The status of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> to view the results of the test.
newCreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse :: Int -> Text -> DeliverabilityTestStatus -> CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse

--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> to view the results of the test.
createDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_deliverabilityTestStatus :: Lens' CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse DeliverabilityTestStatus

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateDeliverabilityTestReport.CreateDeliverabilityTestReport


-- | Create a new pool of dedicated IP addresses. A pool can include one or
--   more dedicated IP addresses that are associated with your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account. You can associate a pool with a configuration set.
--   When you send an email that uses that configuration set, Amazon
--   Pinpoint sends it using only the IP addresses in the associated pool.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateDedicatedIpPool

-- | A request to create a new dedicated IP pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDedicatedIpPool</a> smart constructor.
data CreateDedicatedIpPool
CreateDedicatedIpPool' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> CreateDedicatedIpPool

-- | An object that defines the tags (keys and values) that you want to
--   associate with the pool.

-- | Create an event destination. In Amazon Pinpoint, <i>events</i> include
--   message sends, deliveries, opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints.
--   <i>Event destinations</i> are places that you can send information
--   about these events to. For example, you can send event data to Amazon
--   SNS to receive notifications when you receive bounces or complaints,
--   or you can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon
--   S3 for long-term storage.
--   
--   A single configuration set can include more than one event
--   destination.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateConfigurationSetEventDestination

-- | A request to add an event destination to a configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateConfigurationSetEventDestination</a> smart
--   constructor.

CreateConfigurationSetEventDestination' :: Text -> Text -> EventDestinationDefinition -> CreateConfigurationSetEventDestination

--   set.

-- | Create a configuration set. <i>Configuration sets</i> are groups of
--   rules that you can apply to the emails you send using Amazon Pinpoint.
--   You apply a configuration set to an email by including a reference to
--   the configuration set in the headers of the email. When you apply a
--   configuration set to an email, all of the rules in that configuration
--   set are applied to the email.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.CreateConfigurationSet

-- | A request to create a configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateConfigurationSet</a> smart constructor.
data CreateConfigurationSet
CreateConfigurationSet' :: Maybe SendingOptions -> Maybe DeliveryOptions -> Maybe TrackingOptions -> Maybe ReputationOptions -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> CreateConfigurationSet

-- | An object that defines whether or not Amazon Pinpoint can send email
--   that you send using the configuration set.
[$sel:sendingOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Maybe SendingOptions

-- | An object that defines the dedicated IP pool that is used to send
--   emails that you send using the configuration set.
[$sel:deliveryOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Maybe DeliveryOptions

-- | An object that defines the open and click tracking options for emails
--   that you send using the configuration set.
[$sel:trackingOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Maybe TrackingOptions

-- | An object that defines whether or not Amazon Pinpoint collects
--   reputation metrics for the emails that you send that use the
--   configuration set.
[$sel:reputationOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Maybe ReputationOptions

-- | An array of objects that define the tags (keys and values) that you
--   want to associate with the configuration set.
[$sel:tags:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The name of the configuration set.
[$sel:configurationSetName:CreateConfigurationSet'] :: CreateConfigurationSet -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateConfigurationSet</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'</a>,
--   <a>createConfigurationSet_sendingOptions</a> - An object that defines
--   whether or not Amazon Pinpoint can send email that you send using the
--   configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'</a>,
--   <a>createConfigurationSet_deliveryOptions</a> - An object that defines
--   the dedicated IP pool that is used to send emails that you send using
--   the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trackingOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'</a>,
--   <a>createConfigurationSet_trackingOptions</a> - An object that defines
--   the open and click tracking options for emails that you send using the
--   configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reputationOptions:CreateConfigurationSet'</a>,
--   <a>createConfigurationSet_reputationOptions</a> - An object that
--   defines whether or not Amazon Pinpoint collects reputation metrics for
--   the emails that you send that use the configuration set.

--   the tags (keys and values) that you want to associate with the
--   configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:CreateConfigurationSet'</a>,
--   <a>createConfigurationSet_configurationSetName</a> - The name of the
--   configuration set.
newCreateConfigurationSet :: Text -> CreateConfigurationSet

-- | Remove one or more tags (keys and values) from a specified resource.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource
UntagResource' :: Text -> [Text] -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to remove
--   one or more tags from.
[$sel:resourceArn:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> Text

-- | The tags (tag keys) that you want to remove from the resource. When
--   you specify a tag key, the action removes both that key and its
--   associated tag value.
--   
--   To remove more than one tag from the resource, append the
--   <tt>TagKeys</tt> parameter and argument for each additional tag to
--   remove, separated by an ampersand. For example:
--   <tt>/v1/email/tags?ResourceArn=ResourceArn&amp;TagKeys=Key1&amp;TagKeys=Key2</tt>
[$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:UntagResource'</a>,
--   <a>untagResource_resourceArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the resource that you want to remove one or more tags from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeys</a> - The
--   tags (tag keys) that you want to remove from the resource. When you
--   specify a tag key, the action removes both that key and its associated
--   tag value.
--   
--   To remove more than one tag from the resource, append the
--   <tt>TagKeys</tt> parameter and argument for each additional tag to
--   remove, separated by an ampersand. For example:
--   <tt>/v1/email/tags?ResourceArn=ResourceArn&amp;TagKeys=Key1&amp;TagKeys=Key2</tt>
newUntagResource :: Text -> UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to remove
--   one or more tags from.
untagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The tags (tag keys) that you want to remove from the resource. When
--   you specify a tag key, the action removes both that key and its
--   associated tag value.
--   
--   To remove more than one tag from the resource, append the
--   <tt>TagKeys</tt> parameter and argument for each additional tag to
--   remove, separated by an ampersand. For example:
--   <tt>/v1/email/tags?ResourceArn=ResourceArn&amp;TagKeys=Key1&amp;TagKeys=Key2</tt>
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | Update the configuration of an event destination for a configuration
--   set.
--   
--   In Amazon Pinpoint, <i>events</i> include message sends, deliveries,
--   opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. <i>Event destinations</i> are
--   places that you can send information about these events to. For
--   example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to receive
--   notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you can use
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term
--   storage.
module Network.AWS.PinpointEmail.UpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination

--   configuration set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateConfigurationSetEventDestination</a> smart
