--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetConfigurationSetResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetConfigurationSetResponse
GetConfigurationSetResponse' :: Maybe SendingOptions -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DeliveryOptions -> Maybe TrackingOptions -> Maybe ReputationOptions -> Maybe [Tag] -> Int -> GetConfigurationSetResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetConfigurationSetResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSetResponse_sendingOptions</a> - An object that
--   defines whether or not Amazon Pinpoint can send email that you send
--   using the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:GetConfigurationSet'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSetResponse_configurationSetName</a> - The name of
--   the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSetResponse_deliveryOptions</a> - An object that
--   defines the dedicated IP pool that is used to send emails that you
--   send using the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trackingOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSetResponse_trackingOptions</a> - An object that
--   defines the open and click tracking options for emails that you send
--   using the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reputationOptions:GetConfigurationSetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSetResponse_reputationOptions</a> - An object that
--   defines whether or not Amazon Pinpoint collects reputation metrics for
--   the emails that you send that use the configuration set.

--   <a>$sel:tags:GetConfigurationSetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSetResponse_tags</a> - An array of objects that
--   define the tags (keys and values) that are associated with the
--   configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetConfigurationSetResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getConfigurationSetResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetConfigurationSetResponse :: Int -> GetConfigurationSetResponse

--   signing configuration for the identity.
--   
--   When you set this value <tt>true</tt>, then the messages that Amazon
--   Pinpoint sends from the identity are DKIM-signed. When you set this
--   value to <tt>false</tt>, then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityDkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityDkimAttributes_emailIdentity</a> - The email
--   identity that you want to change the DKIM settings for.

--   configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tlsPolicy:PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>putConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions_tlsPolicy</a> - Specifies
--   whether messages that use the configuration set are required to use
--   Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is <tt>Require</tt>,
--   messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can be established. If
--   the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be delivered in plain
--   text if a TLS connection can't be established.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:PutConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>putConfigurationSetDeliveryOptions_configurationSetName</a> - The
--   name of the configuration set that you want to associate with a
--   dedicated IP pool.

-- | A request to obtain a list of dedicated IP pools.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newListDedicatedIpPools</a> smart constructor.
data ListDedicatedIpPools
ListDedicatedIpPools' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> ListDedicatedIpPools

-- | Create a value of <a>ListDedicatedIpPools</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListDedicatedIpPools'</a>,
--   <a>listDedicatedIpPools_nextToken</a> - A token returned from a
--   previous call to <tt>ListDedicatedIpPools</tt> to indicate the
--   position in the list of dedicated IP pools.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageSize:ListDedicatedIpPools'</a>,
--   <a>listDedicatedIpPools_pageSize</a> - The number of results to show
--   in a single call to <tt>ListDedicatedIpPools</tt>. If the number of
--   results is larger than the number you specified in this parameter,
--   then the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can
--   use to obtain additional results.
newListDedicatedIpPools :: ListDedicatedIpPools

--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes
PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>$sel:emailForwardingEnabled:PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes_emailForwardingEnabled</a> -
--   Sets the feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email
--   notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint
--   sends this notification to the address that you specified in the
--   Return-Path header of the original email.
--   
--   When you set this value to <tt>false</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon
--   SNS topic or another event destination. You're required to have a
--   method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set up
--   another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends an email notification when these events occur
--   (even if this setting is disabled).
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityFeedbackAttributes_emailIdentity</a> - The email
--   identity that you want to configure bounce and complaint feedback
--   forwarding for.

--   results is larger than the number you specified in this parameter,
--   then the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element, which you can
--   use to obtain additional results.
newListConfigurationSets :: ListConfigurationSets

--   feedback forwarding configuration for the identity.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends you email
--   notifications when bounce or complaint events occur. Amazon Pinpoint
--   sends this notification to the address that you specified in the
--   Return-Path header of the original email.
--   
--   When you set this value to <tt>false</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint sends
--   notifications through other mechanisms, such as by notifying an Amazon
--   SNS topic or another event destination. You're required to have a
--   method of tracking bounces and complaints. If you haven't set up
--   another mechanism for receiving bounce or complaint notifications,
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends an email notification when these events occur
--   (even if this setting is disabled).
--

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetAccountResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetAccountResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetAccountResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enforcementStatus:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_enforcementStatus</a> - The reputation status of
--   your Amazon Pinpoint account. The status can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>HEALTHY</tt> – There are no reputation-related issues that
--   currently impact your account.</li>
--   <li><tt>PROBATION</tt> – We've identified some issues with your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account. We're placing your account under review while you
--   work on correcting these issues.</li>
--   <li><tt>SHUTDOWN</tt> – Your account's ability to send email is
--   currently paused because of an issue with the email sent from your
--   account. When you correct the issue, you can contact us and request
--   that your account's ability to send email is resumed.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_dedicatedIpAutoWarmupEnabled</a> - Indicates
--   whether or not the automatic warm-up feature is enabled for dedicated
--   IP addresses that are associated with your account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendQuota:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_sendQuota</a> - An object that contains
--   information about the per-day and per-second sending limits for your
--   Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productionAccessEnabled:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_productionAccessEnabled</a> - Indicates whether
--   or not your account has production access in the current AWS Region.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then your account is in the
--   <i>sandbox</i>. When your account is in the sandbox, you can only send
--   email to verified identities. Additionally, the maximum number of
--   emails you can send in a 24-hour period (your sending quota) is 200,
--   and the maximum number of emails you can send per second (your maximum
--   sending rate) is 1.
--   
--   If the value is <tt>true</tt>, then your account has production
--   access. When your account has production access, you can send email to
--   any address. The sending quota and maximum sending rate for your
--   account vary based on your specific use case.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingEnabled:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_sendingEnabled</a> - Indicates whether or not
--   email sending is enabled for your Amazon Pinpoint account in the
--   current AWS Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getAccountResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetAccountResponse :: Int -> GetAccountResponse

--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:GetDomainStatisticsReport'</a>,
--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReport_startDate</a> - The first day (in Unix
--   time) that you want to obtain domain deliverability metrics for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDate:GetDomainStatisticsReport'</a>,
--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReport_endDate</a> - The last day (in Unix time)
--   that you want to obtain domain deliverability metrics for. The
--   <tt>EndDate</tt> that you specify has to be less than or equal to 30
--   days after the <tt>StartDate</tt>.
newGetDomainStatisticsReport :: Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> GetDomainStatisticsReport

-- | An object that includes statistics that are related to the domain that
--   you specified.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDomainStatisticsReportResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse
GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse' :: Int -> OverallVolume -> [DailyVolume] -> GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   http status code.

--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReportResponse_overallVolume</a> - An object
--   that contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you
--   specified. The data in this object is a summary of all of the data
--   that was collected from the <tt>StartDate</tt> to the
--   <tt>EndDate</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dailyVolumes:GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDomainStatisticsReportResponse_dailyVolumes</a> - An object that
--   contains deliverability metrics for the domain that you specified.
--   This object contains data for each day, starting on the
--   <tt>StartDate</tt> and ending on the <tt>EndDate</tt>.
newGetDomainStatisticsReportResponse :: Int -> OverallVolume -> GetDomainStatisticsReportResponse

-- | Retrieve information about the status of the Deliverability dashboard
--   for your Amazon Pinpoint account. When the Deliverability dashboard is
--   enabled, you gain access to reputation, deliverability, and other
--   metrics for the domains that you use to send email using Amazon
--   Pinpoint. You also gain the ability to perform predictive inbox
--   placement tests.
--   
--   When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly
--   subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by
--   using Amazon Pinpoint. For more information about the features and
--   cost of a Deliverability dashboard subscription, see <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint Pricing</a>.

-- | A request to send an email message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendEmail</a> smart constructor.
data SendEmail
SendEmail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MessageTag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Destination -> EmailContent -> SendEmail

-- | Create a value of <a>SendEmail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_fromEmailAddress</a> - The email address that you want to
--   use as the "From" address for the email. The address that you specify
--   has to be verified.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationSetName:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_configurationSetName</a> - The name of the configuration
--   set that you want to use when sending the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailTags:SendEmail'</a>, <a>sendEmail_emailTags</a> - A list
--   of tags, in the form of name/value pairs, to apply to an email that
--   you send using the <tt>SendEmail</tt> operation. Tags correspond to
--   characteristics of the email that you define, so that you can publish
--   email sending events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:feedbackForwardingEmailAddress:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_feedbackForwardingEmailAddress</a> - The address that
--   Amazon Pinpoint should send bounce and complaint notifications to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:replyToAddresses:SendEmail'</a>,
--   <a>sendEmail_replyToAddresses</a> - The "Reply-to" email addresses for
--   the message. When the recipient replies to the message, each Reply-to
--   address receives the reply.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destination:SendEmail'</a>, <a>sendEmail_destination</a> - An
--   object that contains the recipients of the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:SendEmail'</a>, <a>sendEmail_content</a> - An object
--   that contains the body of the message. You can send either a Simple
--   message or a Raw message.
newSendEmail :: Destination -> EmailContent -> SendEmail

--   it. This can happen when the message you're trying to send has an
--   attachment doesn't pass a virus check, or when you send a templated
--   email that contains invalid personalization content, for example.

-- | A request to perform a predictive inbox placement test. Predictive
--   inbox placement tests can help you predict how your messages will be
--   handled by various email providers around the world. When you perform
--   a predictive inbox placement test, you provide a sample message that
--   contains the content that you plan to send to your customers. Amazon
--   Pinpoint then sends that message to special email addresses spread
--   across several major email providers. After about 24 hours, the test
--   is complete, and you can use the <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt>
--   operation to view the results of the test.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDeliverabilityTestReport</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateDeliverabilityTestReport
CreateDeliverabilityTestReport' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> EmailContent -> CreateDeliverabilityTestReport

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateDeliverabilityTestReport</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportName:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReport_reportName</a> - A unique name that
--   helps you to identify the predictive inbox placement test when you
--   retrieve the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReport_tags</a> - An array of objects that
--   define the tags (keys and values) that you want to associate with the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReport_fromEmailAddress</a> - The email
--   address that the predictive inbox placement test email was sent from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:CreateDeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReport_content</a> - The HTML body of the
--   message that you sent when you performed the predictive inbox
--   placement test.
newCreateDeliverabilityTestReport :: Text -> EmailContent -> CreateDeliverabilityTestReport

-- | Information about the predictive inbox placement test that you
--   created.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse
CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse' :: Int -> Text -> DeliverabilityTestStatus -> CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportId:CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_reportId</a> - A unique
--   string that identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliverabilityTestStatus:CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createDeliverabilityTestReportResponse_deliverabilityTestStatus</a>
--   - The status of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> to view the results of the test.
newCreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse :: Int -> Text -> DeliverabilityTestStatus -> CreateDeliverabilityTestReportResponse

-- | A request to configure the custom MAIL FROM domain for a verified
--   identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes
PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BehaviorOnMxFailure -> Text -> PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomain:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain</a> - The custom
--   MAIL FROM domain that you want the verified identity to use. The MAIL
--   FROM domain must meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It has to be a subdomain of the verified identity.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used to receive email.</li>
--   <li>It can't be used in a "From" address if the MAIL FROM domain is a
--   destination for feedback forwarding emails.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure</a> - The
--   action that you want Amazon Pinpoint to take if it can't read the
--   required MX record when you send an email. When you set this value to
--   <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint uses <i>amazonses.com</i> as
--   the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to
--   <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't attempt to
--   deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailIdentity:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>putEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes_emailIdentity</a> - The verified
--   email identity that you want to set up the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   for.
newPutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes :: Text -> PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributes

-- | An HTTP 200 response if the request succeeds, or an error message if
--   the request fails.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse
PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse' :: Int -> PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PutEmailIdentityMailFromAttributesResponse'</a>,

--   to show in a single call to <tt>ListDeliverabilityTestReports</tt>. If

--   parameter, then the response includes a <tt>NextToken</tt> element,
--   which you can use to obtain additional results.

--   1000.

--   providers, including Gmail, Hotmail, Yahoo, AOL, and others.
newGetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse :: Int -> DeliverabilityTestReport -> PlacementStatistics -> GetDeliverabilityTestReportResponse

-- | Enable or disable the Deliverability dashboard for your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account. When you enable the Deliverability dashboard, you
--   gain access to reputation, deliverability, and other metrics for the
--   domains that you use to send email using Amazon Pinpoint. You also
--   gain the ability to perform predictive inbox placement tests.
--   
--   When you use the Deliverability dashboard, you pay a monthly
--   subscription charge, in addition to any other fees that you accrue by
--   using Amazon Pinpoint. For more information about the features and
--   cost of a Deliverability dashboard subscription, see <a>Amazon
--   Pinpoint Pricing</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:subscribedDomains:PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption'</a>,
--   <a>putDeliverabilityDashboardOption_subscribedDomains</a> - An array
--   of objects, one for each verified domain that you use to send email
--   and enabled the Deliverability dashboard for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dashboardEnabled:PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption'</a>,
--   <a>putDeliverabilityDashboardOption_dashboardEnabled</a> - Specifies
--   whether to enable the Deliverability dashboard for your Amazon
--   Pinpoint account. To enable the dashboard, set this value to
--   <tt>true</tt>.
newPutDeliverabilityDashboardOption :: Bool -> PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption

newPutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributesResponse :: Int -> PutAccountDedicatedIpWarmupAttributesResponse

-- | The action that you want Amazon Pinpoint to take if it can't read the
--   required MX record for a custom MAIL FROM domain. When you set this
--   value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint uses
--   <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value
--   to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint returns a
--   <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't attempt to
--   deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
newtype BehaviorOnMxFailure
BehaviorOnMxFailure' :: Text -> BehaviorOnMxFailure
[fromBehaviorOnMxFailure] :: BehaviorOnMxFailure -> Text
pattern BehaviorOnMxFailure_REJECT_MESSAGE :: BehaviorOnMxFailure
pattern BehaviorOnMxFailure_USE_DEFAULT_VALUE :: BehaviorOnMxFailure

-- | The current status of your Deliverability dashboard subscription. If
--   this value is <tt>PENDING_EXPIRATION</tt>, your subscription is
--   scheduled to expire at the end of the current calendar month.
newtype DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus
DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus' :: Text -> DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus
[fromDeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus] :: DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus -> Text
pattern DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus_ACTIVE :: DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus
pattern DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus_DISABLED :: DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus
pattern DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus_PENDING_EXPIRATION :: DeliverabilityDashboardAccountStatus

-- | The status of a predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> operation to view the results of
--   the test.
newtype DeliverabilityTestStatus
DeliverabilityTestStatus' :: Text -> DeliverabilityTestStatus
[fromDeliverabilityTestStatus] :: DeliverabilityTestStatus -> Text
pattern DeliverabilityTestStatus_COMPLETED :: DeliverabilityTestStatus
pattern DeliverabilityTestStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: DeliverabilityTestStatus

-- | The location where Amazon Pinpoint finds the value of a dimension to
--   publish to Amazon CloudWatch. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use the
--   message tags that you specify using an X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS header or a
--   parameter to the SendEmail/SendRawEmail API, choose
--   <tt>messageTag</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use your own email
--   headers, choose <tt>emailHeader</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to
--   use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
newtype DimensionValueSource
DimensionValueSource' :: Text -> DimensionValueSource
[fromDimensionValueSource] :: DimensionValueSource -> Text
pattern DimensionValueSource_EMAIL_HEADER :: DimensionValueSource
pattern DimensionValueSource_LINK_TAG :: DimensionValueSource
pattern DimensionValueSource_MESSAGE_TAG :: DimensionValueSource

-- | The DKIM authentication status of the identity. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – The DKIM verification process was initiated,
--   and Amazon Pinpoint is still waiting for the required CNAME records to
--   appear in the DNS configuration for the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – The DKIM authentication process completed
--   successfully.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – The DKIM authentication process failed. This can
--   happen when Amazon Pinpoint fails to find the required CNAME records
--   in the DNS configuration of the domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue is preventing
--   Amazon Pinpoint from determining the DKIM authentication status of the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt> – The DKIM verification process hasn't been
--   initiated for the domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype DkimStatus
DkimStatus' :: Text -> DkimStatus
[fromDkimStatus] :: DkimStatus -> Text
pattern DkimStatus_FAILED :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_NOT_STARTED :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_PENDING :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_SUCCESS :: DkimStatus
pattern DkimStatus_TEMPORARY_FAILURE :: DkimStatus

-- | An email sending event type. For example, email sends, opens, and
--   bounces are all email events.
newtype EventType
EventType' :: Text -> EventType
[fromEventType] :: EventType -> Text
pattern EventType_BOUNCE :: EventType
pattern EventType_CLICK :: EventType
pattern EventType_COMPLAINT :: EventType
pattern EventType_DELIVERY :: EventType
pattern EventType_OPEN :: EventType
pattern EventType_REJECT :: EventType
pattern EventType_RENDERING_FAILURE :: EventType
pattern EventType_SEND :: EventType

-- | The email identity type. The identity type can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>EMAIL_ADDRESS</tt> – The identity is an email address.</li>
--   <li><tt>DOMAIN</tt> – The identity is a domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype IdentityType
IdentityType' :: Text -> IdentityType
[fromIdentityType] :: IdentityType -> Text
pattern IdentityType_DOMAIN :: IdentityType
pattern IdentityType_EMAIL_ADDRESS :: IdentityType
pattern IdentityType_MANAGED_DOMAIN :: IdentityType

-- | The status of the MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't started searching for
--   the MX record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint detected the required MX record
--   for the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint can't find the required MX
--   record, or the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newtype MailFromDomainStatus
MailFromDomainStatus' :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus
[fromMailFromDomainStatus] :: MailFromDomainStatus -> Text
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_FAILED :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_PENDING :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_SUCCESS :: MailFromDomainStatus
pattern MailFromDomainStatus_TEMPORARY_FAILURE :: MailFromDomainStatus

-- | Specifies whether messages that use the configuration set are required
--   to use Transport Layer Security (TLS). If the value is
--   <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered if a TLS connection can
--   be established. If the value is <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be
--   delivered in plain text if a TLS connection can't be established.
newtype TlsPolicy
TlsPolicy' :: Text -> TlsPolicy
[fromTlsPolicy] :: TlsPolicy -> Text
pattern TlsPolicy_OPTIONAL :: TlsPolicy
pattern TlsPolicy_REQUIRE :: TlsPolicy

-- | The warmup status of a dedicated IP.
newtype WarmupStatus
WarmupStatus' :: Text -> WarmupStatus
[fromWarmupStatus] :: WarmupStatus -> Text
pattern WarmupStatus_DONE :: WarmupStatus
pattern WarmupStatus_IN_PROGRESS :: WarmupStatus

-- | An object that contains information about a blacklisting event that
--   impacts one of the dedicated IP addresses that is associated with your
--   account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlacklistEntry</a> smart constructor.
data BlacklistEntry
BlacklistEntry' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BlacklistEntry

-- | Create a value of <a>BlacklistEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:listingTime:BlacklistEntry'</a>,
--   <a>blacklistEntry_listingTime</a> - The time when the blacklisting
--   event occurred, shown in Unix time format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rblName:BlacklistEntry'</a>, <a>blacklistEntry_rblName</a> -
--   The name of the blacklist that the IP address appears on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:BlacklistEntry'</a>,
--   <a>blacklistEntry_description</a> - Additional information about the
--   blacklisting event, as provided by the blacklist maintainer.
newBlacklistEntry :: BlacklistEntry

-- | Represents the body of the email message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBody</a> smart constructor.
data Body
Body' :: Maybe Content -> Maybe Content -> Body

-- | Create a value of <a>Body</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:Body'</a>, <a>body_text</a> - An object that represents
--   the version of the message that is displayed in email clients that
--   don't support HTML, or clients where the recipient has disabled HTML
--   rendering.
--   
--   <a>$sel:html:Body'</a>, <a>body_html</a> - An object that represents
--   the version of the message that is displayed in email clients that
--   support HTML. HTML messages can include formatted text, hyperlinks,
--   images, and more.
newBody :: Body

-- | An object that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email
--   events. You can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on
--   your email sending metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchDestination</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchDestination
CloudWatchDestination' :: [CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration] -> CloudWatchDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionConfigurations:CloudWatchDestination'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDestination_dimensionConfigurations</a> - An array of
--   objects that define the dimensions to use when you send email events
--   to Amazon CloudWatch.
newCloudWatchDestination :: CloudWatchDestination

-- | An object that defines the dimension configuration to use when you
--   send Amazon Pinpoint email events to Amazon CloudWatch.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchDimensionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration
CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration' :: Text -> DimensionValueSource -> Text -> CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionName:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionName</a> - The name of an
--   Amazon CloudWatch dimension associated with an email sending metric.
--   The name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensionValueSource:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_dimensionValueSource</a> - The
--   location where Amazon Pinpoint finds the value of a dimension to
--   publish to Amazon CloudWatch. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use the
--   message tags that you specify using an X-SES-MESSAGE-TAGS header or a
--   parameter to the SendEmail/SendRawEmail API, choose
--   <tt>messageTag</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to use your own email
--   headers, choose <tt>emailHeader</tt>. If you want Amazon Pinpoint to
--   use link tags, choose <tt>linkTags</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultDimensionValue:CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchDimensionConfiguration_defaultDimensionValue</a> - The
--   default value of the dimension that is published to Amazon CloudWatch
--   if you don't provide the value of the dimension when you send an
--   email. This value has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newCloudWatchDimensionConfiguration :: Text -> DimensionValueSource -> Text -> CloudWatchDimensionConfiguration

-- | An object that represents the content of the email, and optionally a
--   character set specification.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContent</a> smart constructor.
data Content
Content' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Content

-- | Create a value of <a>Content</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:charset:Content'</a>, <a>content_charset</a> - The character
--   set for the content. Because of the constraints of the SMTP protocol,
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses 7-bit ASCII by default. If the text includes
--   characters outside of the ASCII range, you have to specify a character
--   set. For example, you could specify <tt>UTF-8</tt>,
--   <tt>ISO-8859-1</tt>, or <tt>Shift_JIS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':Content'</a>, <a>content_data</a> - The content of the
--   message itself.
newContent :: Text -> Content

-- | An object that contains information about the volume of email sent on
--   each day of the analysis period.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDailyVolume</a> smart constructor.
data DailyVolume
DailyVolume' :: Maybe [DomainIspPlacement] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe VolumeStatistics -> DailyVolume

-- | Create a value of <a>DailyVolume</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainIspPlacements:DailyVolume'</a>,
--   <a>dailyVolume_domainIspPlacements</a> - An object that contains inbox
--   placement metrics for a specified day in the analysis period, broken
--   out by the recipient's email provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:DailyVolume'</a>, <a>dailyVolume_startDate</a> - The
--   date that the DailyVolume metrics apply to, in Unix time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeStatistics:DailyVolume'</a>,
--   <a>dailyVolume_volumeStatistics</a> - An object that contains inbox
--   placement metrics for a specific day in the analysis period.
newDailyVolume :: DailyVolume

-- | Contains information about a dedicated IP address that is associated
--   with your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDedicatedIp</a> smart constructor.
data DedicatedIp
DedicatedIp' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> WarmupStatus -> Int -> DedicatedIp

-- | Create a value of <a>DedicatedIp</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:poolName:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_poolName</a> - The
--   name of the dedicated IP pool that the IP address is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ip:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_ip</a> - An IP address
--   that is reserved for use by your Amazon Pinpoint account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:warmupStatus:DedicatedIp'</a>, <a>dedicatedIp_warmupStatus</a>
--   - The warm-up status of a dedicated IP address. The status can have
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt> – The IP address isn't ready to use because
--   the dedicated IP warm-up process is ongoing.</li>
--   <li><tt>DONE</tt> – The dedicated IP warm-up process is complete, and
--   the IP address is ready to use.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:warmupPercentage:DedicatedIp'</a>,
--   <a>dedicatedIp_warmupPercentage</a> - Indicates how complete the
--   dedicated IP warm-up process is. When this value equals 1, the address
--   has completed the warm-up process and is ready for use.
newDedicatedIp :: Text -> WarmupStatus -> Int -> DedicatedIp

-- | An object that contains metadata related to a predictive inbox
--   placement test.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliverabilityTestReport</a> smart constructor.
data DeliverabilityTestReport
DeliverabilityTestReport' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DeliverabilityTestStatus -> DeliverabilityTestReport

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliverabilityTestReport</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_subject</a> - The subject line for an
--   email that you submitted in a predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromEmailAddress:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_fromEmailAddress</a> - The sender address
--   that you specified for the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_createDate</a> - The date and time when
--   the predictive inbox placement test was created, in Unix time format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportId:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_reportId</a> - A unique string that
--   identifies the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportName:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_reportName</a> - A name that helps you
--   identify a predictive inbox placement test report.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliverabilityTestStatus:DeliverabilityTestReport'</a>,
--   <a>deliverabilityTestReport_deliverabilityTestStatus</a> - The status
--   of the predictive inbox placement test. If the status is
--   <tt>IN_PROGRESS</tt>, then the predictive inbox placement test is
--   currently running. Predictive inbox placement tests are usually
--   complete within 24 hours of creating the test. If the status is
--   <tt>COMPLETE</tt>, then the test is finished, and you can use the
--   <tt>GetDeliverabilityTestReport</tt> to view the results of the test.
newDeliverabilityTestReport :: DeliverabilityTestReport

-- | Used to associate a configuration set with a dedicated IP pool.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeliveryOptions</a> smart constructor.
data DeliveryOptions
DeliveryOptions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TlsPolicy -> DeliveryOptions

-- | Create a value of <a>DeliveryOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingPoolName:DeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryOptions_sendingPoolName</a> - The name of the dedicated IP
--   pool that you want to associate with the configuration set.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tlsPolicy:DeliveryOptions'</a>,
--   <a>deliveryOptions_tlsPolicy</a> - Specifies whether messages that use
--   the configuration set are required to use Transport Layer Security
--   (TLS). If the value is <tt>Require</tt>, messages are only delivered
--   if a TLS connection can be established. If the value is
--   <tt>Optional</tt>, messages can be delivered in plain text if a TLS
--   connection can't be established.
newDeliveryOptions :: DeliveryOptions

-- | An object that describes the recipients for an email.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDestination</a> smart constructor.
data Destination
Destination' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Destination

-- | Create a value of <a>Destination</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bccAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_bccAddresses</a>
--   - An array that contains the email addresses of the "BCC" (blind
--   carbon copy) recipients for the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ccAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_ccAddresses</a> -
--   An array that contains the email addresses of the "CC" (carbon copy)
--   recipients for the email.
--   
--   <a>$sel:toAddresses:Destination'</a>, <a>destination_toAddresses</a> -
--   An array that contains the email addresses of the "To" recipients for
--   the email.
newDestination :: Destination

-- | An object that contains information about the DKIM configuration for
--   an email identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDkimAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data DkimAttributes
DkimAttributes' :: Maybe DkimStatus -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> DkimAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>DkimAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DkimAttributes'</a>, <a>dkimAttributes_status</a> -
--   Describes whether or not Amazon Pinpoint has successfully located the
--   DKIM records in the DNS records for the domain. The status can be one
--   of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't yet located the DKIM
--   records in the DNS configuration for the domain, but will continue to
--   attempt to locate them.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint located the DKIM records in the
--   DNS configuration for the domain and determined that they're correct.
--   Amazon Pinpoint can now send DKIM-signed email from the identity.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint was unable to locate the DKIM
--   records in the DNS settings for the domain, and won't continue to
--   search for them.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the DKIM status for the
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOT_STARTED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't yet started
--   searching for the DKIM records in the DKIM records for the
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tokens:DkimAttributes'</a>, <a>dkimAttributes_tokens</a> - A
--   set of unique strings that you use to create a set of CNAME records
--   that you add to the DNS configuration for your domain. When Amazon
--   Pinpoint detects these records in the DNS configuration for your
--   domain, the DKIM authentication process is complete. Amazon Pinpoint
--   usually detects these records within about 72 hours of adding them to
--   the DNS configuration for your domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signingEnabled:DkimAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>dkimAttributes_signingEnabled</a> - If the value is <tt>true</tt>,
--   then the messages that Amazon Pinpoint sends from the identity are
--   DKIM-signed. If the value is <tt>false</tt>, then the messages that
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends from the identity aren't DKIM-signed.
newDkimAttributes :: DkimAttributes

-- | An object that contains the deliverability data for a specific
--   campaign. This data is available for a campaign only if the campaign
--   sent email by using a domain that the Deliverability dashboard is
--   enabled for (<tt>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</tt> operation).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainDeliverabilityCampaign</a> smart constructor.
data DomainDeliverabilityCampaign
DomainDeliverabilityCampaign' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe POSIX -> DomainDeliverabilityCampaign

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainDeliverabilityCampaign</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamCount:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_spamCount</a> - The number of email
--   messages that were delivered to recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_subject</a> - The subject line, or
--   title, of the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:esps:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_esps</a> - The major email providers
--   who handled the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAddress:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_fromAddress</a> - The verified email
--   address that the email message was sent from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_deleteRate</a> - The percentage of
--   email messages that were deleted by recipients, without being opened
--   first. Due to technical limitations, this value only includes
--   recipients who opened the message by using an email client that
--   supports images.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignId:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_campaignId</a> - The unique identifier
--   for the campaign. Amazon Pinpoint automatically generates and assigns
--   this identifier to a campaign. This value is not the same as the
--   campaign identifier that Amazon Pinpoint assigns to campaigns that you
--   create and manage by using the Amazon Pinpoint API or the Amazon
--   Pinpoint console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingIps:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_sendingIps</a> - The IP addresses that
--   were used to send the email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firstSeenDateTime:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_firstSeenDateTime</a> - The first
--   time, in Unix time format, when the email message was delivered to any
--   recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine how long it took
--   for a campaign to deliver an email message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxCount:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_inboxCount</a> - The number of email
--   messages that were delivered to recipients’ inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readDeleteRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_readDeleteRate</a> - The percentage of
--   email messages that were opened and then deleted by recipients. Due to
--   technical limitations, this value only includes recipients who opened
--   the message by using an email client that supports images.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedVolume:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_projectedVolume</a> - The projected
--   number of recipients that the email message was sent to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:imageUrl:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_imageUrl</a> - The URL of an image
--   that contains a snapshot of the email message that was sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readRate:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_readRate</a> - The percentage of email
--   messages that were opened by recipients. Due to technical limitations,
--   this value only includes recipients who opened the message by using an
--   email client that supports images.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastSeenDateTime:DomainDeliverabilityCampaign'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityCampaign_lastSeenDateTime</a> - The last time,
--   in Unix time format, when the email message was delivered to any
--   recipient's inbox. This value can help you determine how long it took
--   for a campaign to deliver an email message.
newDomainDeliverabilityCampaign :: DomainDeliverabilityCampaign

-- | An object that contains information about the Deliverability dashboard
--   subscription for a verified domain that you use to send email and
--   currently has an active Deliverability dashboard subscription. If a
--   Deliverability dashboard subscription is active for a domain, you gain
--   access to reputation, inbox placement, and other metrics for the
--   domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption'</a>,
--   <a>domainDeliverabilityTrackingOption_domain</a> - A verified domain
--   that’s associated with your AWS account and currently has an active
--   Deliverability dashboard subscription.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subscriptionStartDate:DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption'</a>,

--   dashboard for the domain.

--   - An object that contains information about the inbox placement data
--   settings for the domain.
newDomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption :: DomainDeliverabilityTrackingOption

-- | An object that contains inbox placement data for email sent from one
--   of your email domains to a specific email provider.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainIspPlacement</a> smart constructor.
data DomainIspPlacement
DomainIspPlacement' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Integer -> DomainIspPlacement

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainIspPlacement</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamPercentage:DomainIspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>domainIspPlacement_spamPercentage</a> - The percentage of messages
--   that were sent from the selected domain to the specified email
--   provider that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxRawCount:DomainIspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>domainIspPlacement_inboxRawCount</a> - The total number of messages
--   that were sent from the selected domain to the specified email
--   provider that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ispName:DomainIspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>domainIspPlacement_ispName</a> - The name of the email provider
--   that the inbox placement data applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxPercentage:DomainIspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>domainIspPlacement_inboxPercentage</a> - The percentage of messages
--   that were sent from the selected domain to the specified email
--   provider that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamRawCount:DomainIspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>domainIspPlacement_spamRawCount</a> - The total number of messages
--   that were sent from the selected domain to the specified email
--   provider that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
newDomainIspPlacement :: DomainIspPlacement

-- | An object that defines the entire content of the email, including the
--   message headers and the body content. You can create a simple email
--   message, in which you specify the subject and the text and HTML
--   versions of the message body. You can also create raw messages, in
--   which you specify a complete MIME-formatted message. Raw messages can
--   include attachments and custom headers.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEmailContent</a> smart constructor.
data EmailContent
EmailContent' :: Maybe RawMessage -> Maybe Message -> Maybe Template -> EmailContent

-- | Create a value of <a>EmailContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:raw:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_raw</a> - The raw email
--   message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>If you include attachments, they must be in a file format that
--   Amazon Pinpoint supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC 5321</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:simple:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_simple</a> - The
--   simple email message. The message consists of a subject and a message
--   body.
--   
--   <a>$sel:template:EmailContent'</a>, <a>emailContent_template</a> - The
--   template to use for the email message.
newEmailContent :: EmailContent

-- | In Amazon Pinpoint, <i>events</i> include message sends, deliveries,
--   opens, clicks, bounces, and complaints. <i>Event destinations</i> are
--   places that you can send information about these events to. For
--   example, you can send event data to Amazon SNS to receive
--   notifications when you receive bounces or complaints, or you can use
--   Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to Amazon S3 for long-term
--   storage.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestination</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestination
EventDestination' :: Maybe PinpointDestination -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination -> Text -> [EventType] -> EventDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_pinpointDestination</a> - An object that defines a
--   Amazon Pinpoint destination for email events. You can use Amazon
--   Pinpoint events to create attributes in Amazon Pinpoint projects. You
--   can use these attributes to create segments for your campaigns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_enabled</a>
--   - If <tt>true</tt>, the event destination is enabled. When the event
--   destination is enabled, the specified event types are sent to the
--   destinations in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for email events.
--   You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data to other
--   services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_cloudWatchDestination</a> - An object that defines
--   an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email events. You can use Amazon
--   CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on your email sending metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsDestination:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_snsDestination</a> - An object that defines an
--   Amazon SNS destination for email events. You can use Amazon SNS to
--   send notification when certain email events occur.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EventDestination'</a>, <a>eventDestination_name</a> - A
--   name that identifies the event destination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestination'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestination_matchingEventTypes</a> - The types of events that
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends to the specified event destinations.
newEventDestination :: Text -> EventDestination

-- | An object that defines the event destination. Specifically, it defines
--   which services receive events from emails sent using the configuration
--   set that the event destination is associated with. Also defines the
--   types of events that are sent to the event destination.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventDestinationDefinition</a> smart constructor.
data EventDestinationDefinition
EventDestinationDefinition' :: Maybe [EventType] -> Maybe PinpointDestination -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseDestination -> Maybe CloudWatchDestination -> Maybe SnsDestination -> EventDestinationDefinition

-- | Create a value of <a>EventDestinationDefinition</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchingEventTypes:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_matchingEventTypes</a> - An array that
--   specifies which events Amazon Pinpoint should send to the destinations
--   in this <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pinpointDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_pinpointDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines a Amazon Pinpoint destination for email events. You can use
--   Amazon Pinpoint events to create attributes in Amazon Pinpoint
--   projects. You can use these attributes to create segments for your
--   campaigns.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_enabled</a> - If <tt>true</tt>, the
--   event destination is enabled. When the event destination is enabled,
--   the specified event types are sent to the destinations in this
--   <tt>EventDestinationDefinition</tt>.
--   
--   If <tt>false</tt>, the event destination is disabled. When the event
--   destination is disabled, events aren't sent to the specified
--   destinations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_kinesisFirehoseDestination</a> - An
--   object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_cloudWatchDestination</a> - An object
--   that defines an Amazon CloudWatch destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and gain insights on your email
--   sending metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsDestination:EventDestinationDefinition'</a>,
--   <a>eventDestinationDefinition_snsDestination</a> - An object that
--   defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You can use Amazon
--   SNS to send notification when certain email events occur.
newEventDestinationDefinition :: EventDestinationDefinition

-- | Information about an email identity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIdentityInfo</a> smart constructor.
data IdentityInfo
IdentityInfo' :: Maybe IdentityType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> IdentityInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>IdentityInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityType:IdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>identityInfo_identityType</a> - The email identity type. The
--   identity type can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>EMAIL_ADDRESS</tt> – The identity is an email address.</li>
--   <li><tt>DOMAIN</tt> – The identity is a domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>MANAGED_DOMAIN</tt> – The identity is a domain that is managed
--   by AWS.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityName:IdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>identityInfo_identityName</a> - The address or domain of the
--   identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingEnabled:IdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>identityInfo_sendingEnabled</a> - Indicates whether or not you can
--   send email from the identity.
--   
--   In Amazon Pinpoint, an identity is an email address or domain that you
--   send email from. Before you can send email from an identity, you have
--   to demostrate that you own the identity, and that you authorize Amazon
--   Pinpoint to send email from that identity.
newIdentityInfo :: IdentityInfo

-- | An object that contains information about the inbox placement data
--   settings for a verified domain that’s associated with your AWS
--   account. This data is available only if you enabled the Deliverability
--   dashboard for the domain (<tt>PutDeliverabilityDashboardOption</tt>
--   operation).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInboxPlacementTrackingOption</a> smart constructor.
data InboxPlacementTrackingOption
InboxPlacementTrackingOption' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> InboxPlacementTrackingOption

-- | Create a value of <a>InboxPlacementTrackingOption</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:trackedIsps:InboxPlacementTrackingOption'</a>,
--   <a>inboxPlacementTrackingOption_trackedIsps</a> - An array of strings,
--   one for each major email provider that the inbox placement data
--   applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:global:InboxPlacementTrackingOption'</a>,
--   <a>inboxPlacementTrackingOption_global</a> - Specifies whether inbox
--   placement data is being tracked for the domain.
newInboxPlacementTrackingOption :: InboxPlacementTrackingOption

-- | An object that describes how email sent during the predictive inbox
--   placement test was handled by a certain email provider.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newIspPlacement</a> smart constructor.
data IspPlacement
IspPlacement' :: Maybe PlacementStatistics -> Maybe Text -> IspPlacement

-- | Create a value of <a>IspPlacement</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:placementStatistics:IspPlacement'</a>,
--   <a>ispPlacement_placementStatistics</a> - An object that contains
--   inbox placement metrics for a specific email provider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ispName:IspPlacement'</a>, <a>ispPlacement_ispName</a> - The
--   name of the email provider that the inbox placement data applies to.
newIspPlacement :: IspPlacement

-- | An object that defines an Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose destination for
--   email events. You can use Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose to stream data
--   to other services, such as Amazon S3 and Amazon Redshift.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisFirehoseDestination</a> smart constructor.
data KinesisFirehoseDestination
KinesisFirehoseDestination' :: Text -> Text -> KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisFirehoseDestination</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamRoleArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisFirehoseDestination_iamRoleArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the IAM role that Amazon Pinpoint uses when sending
--   email events to the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deliveryStreamArn:KinesisFirehoseDestination'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisFirehoseDestination_deliveryStreamArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose stream that
--   Amazon Pinpoint sends email events to.
newKinesisFirehoseDestination :: Text -> Text -> KinesisFirehoseDestination

-- | A list of attributes that are associated with a MAIL FROM domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMailFromAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data MailFromAttributes
MailFromAttributes' :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus -> BehaviorOnMxFailure -> MailFromAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>MailFromAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomain:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomain</a> - The name of a domain that
--   an email identity uses as a custom MAIL FROM domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mailFromDomainStatus:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_mailFromDomainStatus</a> - The status of the
--   MAIL FROM domain. This status can have the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint hasn't started searching for
--   the MX record yet.</li>
--   <li><tt>SUCCESS</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint detected the required MX record
--   for the MAIL FROM domain.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt> – Amazon Pinpoint can't find the required MX
--   record, or the record no longer exists.</li>
--   <li><tt>TEMPORARY_FAILURE</tt> – A temporary issue occurred, which
--   prevented Amazon Pinpoint from determining the status of the MAIL FROM
--   domain.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:behaviorOnMxFailure:MailFromAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>mailFromAttributes_behaviorOnMxFailure</a> - The action that Amazon
--   Pinpoint to takes if it can't read the required MX record for a custom
--   MAIL FROM domain. When you set this value to <tt>UseDefaultValue</tt>,
--   Amazon Pinpoint uses <i>amazonses.com</i> as the MAIL FROM domain.
--   When you set this value to <tt>RejectMessage</tt>, Amazon Pinpoint
--   returns a <tt>MailFromDomainNotVerified</tt> error, and doesn't
--   attempt to deliver the email.
--   
--   These behaviors are taken when the custom MAIL FROM domain
--   configuration is in the <tt>Pending</tt>, <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   <tt>TemporaryFailure</tt> states.
newMailFromAttributes :: Text -> MailFromDomainStatus -> BehaviorOnMxFailure -> MailFromAttributes

-- | Represents the email message that you're sending. The <tt>Message</tt>
--   object consists of a subject line and a message body.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessage</a> smart constructor.
data Message
Message' :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | Create a value of <a>Message</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subject:Message'</a>, <a>message_subject</a> - The subject
--   line of the email. The subject line can only contain 7-bit ASCII
--   characters. However, you can specify non-ASCII characters in the
--   subject line by using encoded-word syntax, as described in <a>RFC
--   2047</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:Message'</a>, <a>message_body</a> - The body of the
--   message. You can specify an HTML version of the message, a text-only
--   version of the message, or both.
newMessage :: Content -> Body -> Message

-- | Contains the name and value of a tag that you apply to an email. You
--   can use message tags when you publish email sending events.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMessageTag</a> smart constructor.
data MessageTag
MessageTag' :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | Create a value of <a>MessageTag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_name</a> - The name of the
--   message tag. The message tag name has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a–z, A–Z), numbers (0–9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:MessageTag'</a>, <a>messageTag_value</a> - The value of
--   the message tag. The message tag value has to meet the following
--   criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>It can only contain ASCII letters (a–z, A–Z), numbers (0–9),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-).</li>
--   <li>It can contain no more than 256 characters.</li>
--   </ul>
newMessageTag :: Text -> Text -> MessageTag

-- | An object that contains information about email that was sent from the
--   selected domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOverallVolume</a> smart constructor.
data OverallVolume
OverallVolume' :: Maybe [DomainIspPlacement] -> Maybe VolumeStatistics -> Maybe Double -> OverallVolume

-- | Create a value of <a>OverallVolume</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainIspPlacements:OverallVolume'</a>,
--   <a>overallVolume_domainIspPlacements</a> - An object that contains
--   inbox and junk mail placement metrics for individual email providers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeStatistics:OverallVolume'</a>,
--   <a>overallVolume_volumeStatistics</a> - An object that contains
--   information about the numbers of messages that arrived in recipients'
--   inboxes and junk mail folders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readRatePercent:OverallVolume'</a>,
--   <a>overallVolume_readRatePercent</a> - The percentage of emails that
--   were sent from the domain that were read by their recipients.
newOverallVolume :: OverallVolume

-- | An object that defines a Amazon Pinpoint destination for email events.
--   You can use Amazon Pinpoint events to create attributes in Amazon
--   Pinpoint projects. You can use these attributes to create segments for
--   your campaigns.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPinpointDestination</a> smart constructor.
data PinpointDestination

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--
