--   (ARN) of the Amazon Pinpoint project that you want to send email
--   events to.
newPinpointDestination :: PinpointDestination

-- | An object that contains inbox placement data for an email provider.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPlacementStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data PlacementStatistics
PlacementStatistics' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> PlacementStatistics

-- | Create a value of <a>PlacementStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_missingPercentage</a> - The percentage of
--   emails that didn't arrive in recipients' inboxes at all during the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_spamPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail folders during the
--   predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spfPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_spfPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that were authenticated by using Sender Policy Framework (SPF) during
--   the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dkimPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_dkimPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that were authenticated by using DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM)
--   during the predictive inbox placement test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxPercentage:PlacementStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>placementStatistics_inboxPercentage</a> - The percentage of emails
--   that arrived in recipients' inboxes during the predictive inbox
--   placement test.
newPlacementStatistics :: PlacementStatistics

-- | The raw email message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRawMessage</a> smart constructor.
data RawMessage
RawMessage' :: Base64 -> RawMessage

-- | Create a value of <a>RawMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:data':RawMessage'</a>, <a>rawMessage_data</a> - The raw email
--   message. The message has to meet the following criteria:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The message has to contain a header and a body, separated by one
--   blank line.</li>
--   <li>All of the required header fields must be present in the
--   message.</li>
--   <li>Each part of a multipart MIME message must be formatted
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>Attachments must be in a file format that Amazon Pinpoint
--   supports.</li>
--   <li>The entire message must be Base64 encoded.</li>
--   <li>If any of the MIME parts in your message contain content that is
--   outside of the 7-bit ASCII character range, you should encode that
--   content to ensure that recipients' email clients render the message
--   properly.</li>
--   <li>The length of any single line of text in the message can't exceed
--   1,000 characters. This restriction is defined in <a>RFC
--   5321</a>.--</li>
--   <li>- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and
--   decodes Base64 data.</li>
--   <li>- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation
--   during</li>
--   <li>- serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation.</li>
--   <li>- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw unencoded
--   data.</li>
--   </ul>
newRawMessage :: ByteString -> RawMessage

-- | Enable or disable collection of reputation metrics for emails that you
--   send using this configuration set in the current AWS Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReputationOptions</a> smart constructor.
data ReputationOptions
ReputationOptions' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> ReputationOptions

-- | Create a value of <a>ReputationOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastFreshStart:ReputationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>reputationOptions_lastFreshStart</a> - The date and time (in Unix
--   time) when the reputation metrics were last given a fresh start. When
--   your account is given a fresh start, your reputation metrics are
--   calculated starting from the date of the fresh start.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reputationMetricsEnabled:ReputationOptions'</a>,
--   <a>reputationOptions_reputationMetricsEnabled</a> - If <tt>true</tt>,
--   tracking of reputation metrics is enabled for the configuration set.
--   If <tt>false</tt>, tracking of reputation metrics is disabled for the
--   configuration set.
newReputationOptions :: ReputationOptions

-- | An object that contains information about the per-day and per-second
--   sending limits for your Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS
--   Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendQuota</a> smart constructor.
data SendQuota

-- | Create a value of <a>SendQuota</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxSendRate:SendQuota'</a>, <a>sendQuota_maxSendRate</a> - The
--   maximum number of emails that you can send per second in the current
--   AWS Region. This value is also called your <i>maximum sending rate</i>
--   or your <i>maximum TPS (transactions per second) rate</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sentLast24Hours:SendQuota'</a>,
--   <a>sendQuota_sentLast24Hours</a> - The number of emails sent from your
--   Amazon Pinpoint account in the current AWS Region over the past 24
--   hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:max24HourSend:SendQuota'</a>, <a>sendQuota_max24HourSend</a> -
--   The maximum number of emails that you can send in the current AWS
--   Region over a 24-hour period. This value is also called your
--   <i>sending quota</i>.
newSendQuota :: SendQuota

-- | Used to enable or disable email sending for messages that use this
--   configuration set in the current AWS Region.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSendingOptions</a> smart constructor.
data SendingOptions

--   omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sendingEnabled:SendingOptions'</a>,
--   <a>sendingOptions_sendingEnabled</a> - If <tt>true</tt>, email sending
--   is enabled for the configuration set. If <tt>false</tt>, email sending
--   is disabled for the configuration set.
newSendingOptions :: SendingOptions

-- | An object that defines an Amazon SNS destination for email events. You
--   can use Amazon SNS to send notification when certain email events
--   occur.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSnsDestination</a> smart constructor.
data SnsDestination
SnsDestination' :: Text -> SnsDestination

-- | Create a value of <a>SnsDestination</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:topicArn:SnsDestination'</a>, <a>snsDestination_topicArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon SNS topic that you want
--   to publish email events to. For more information about Amazon SNS
--   topics, see the <a>Amazon SNS Developer Guide</a>.
newSnsDestination :: Text -> SnsDestination

-- | An object that defines the tags that are associated with a resource. A
--   <i>tag</i> is a label that you optionally define and associate with a
--   resource in Amazon Pinpoint. Tags can help you categorize and manage
--   resources in different ways, such as by purpose, owner, environment,
--   or other criteria. A resource can have as many as 50 tags.
--   
--   Each tag consists of a required <i>tag key</i> and an associated
--   <i>tag value</i>, both of which you define. A tag key is a general
--   label that acts as a category for a more specific tag value. A tag
--   value acts as a descriptor within a tag key. A tag key can contain as
--   many as 128 characters. A tag value can contain as many as 256
--   characters. The characters can be Unicode letters, digits, white
--   space, or one of the following symbols: _ . : / = + -. The following
--   additional restrictions apply to tags:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Tag keys and values are case sensitive.</li>
--   <li>For each associated resource, each tag key must be unique and it
--   can have only one value.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>aws:</tt> prefix is reserved for use by AWS; you can’t use
--   it in any tag keys or values that you define. In addition, you can't
--   edit or remove tag keys or values that use this prefix. Tags that use
--   this prefix don’t count against the limit of 50 tags per
--   resource.</li>
--   <li>You can associate tags with public or shared resources, but the
--   tags are available only for your AWS account, not any other accounts
--   that share the resource. In addition, the tags are available only for
--   resources that are located in the specified AWS Region for your AWS
--   account.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - One part of a key-value pair
--   that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters.
--   The minimum length is 1 character.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The optional part of a
--   key-value pair that defines a tag. The maximum length of a tag value
--   is 256 characters. The minimum length is 0 characters. If you don’t
--   want a resource to have a specific tag value, don’t specify a value
--   for this parameter. Amazon Pinpoint will set the value to an empty
--   string.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTemplate</a> smart constructor.
data Template
Template' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Template

-- | Create a value of <a>Template</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateArn:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the template.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateData:Template'</a>, <a>template_templateData</a> - An
--   object that defines the values to use for message variables in the
--   template. This object is a set of key-value pairs. Each key defines a
--   message variable in the template. The corresponding value defines the
--   value to use for that variable.
newTemplate :: Template

-- | An object that defines the tracking options for a configuration set.
--   When you use Amazon Pinpoint to send an email, it contains an
--   invisible image that's used to track when recipients open your email.
--   If your email contains links, those links are changed slightly in
--   order to track when recipients click them.
--   
--   These images and links include references to a domain operated by AWS.
--   You can optionally configure Amazon Pinpoint to use a domain that you
--   operate for these images and links.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTrackingOptions</a> smart constructor.
data TrackingOptions
TrackingOptions' :: Text -> TrackingOptions

-- | Create a value of <a>TrackingOptions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customRedirectDomain:TrackingOptions'</a>,
--   <a>trackingOptions_customRedirectDomain</a> - The domain that you want
--   to use for tracking open and click events.
newTrackingOptions :: Text -> TrackingOptions

-- | An object that contains information about the amount of email that was
--   delivered to recipients.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeStatistics</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeStatistics
VolumeStatistics' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> VolumeStatistics

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeStatistics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboxRawCount:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_inboxRawCount</a> - The total number of emails
--   that arrived in recipients' inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedSpam:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_projectedSpam</a> - An estimate of the percentage
--   of emails sent from the current domain that will arrive in recipients'
--   spam or junk mail folders.
--   
--   <a>$sel:projectedInbox:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_projectedInbox</a> - An estimate of the percentage
--   of emails sent from the current domain that will arrive in recipients'
--   inboxes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:spamRawCount:VolumeStatistics'</a>,
--   <a>volumeStatistics_spamRawCount</a> - The total number of emails that
--   arrived in recipients' spam or junk mail folders.
newVolumeStatistics :: VolumeStatistics
